nodes.name: Town Builder
nodes.risks:
The creative work is currently being written. The writing is going well and is anticipated to be complete for delivery no later than the end of March, 2024. 

PDF & Print-on-Demand (POD) fulfillment is via the excellent services of DriveThruRPG.
nodes.story:
When players wander into a town, they expect certain basic amenities. Taverns, inns, general store, and a blacksmith are the most common businesses they find with the general store being a catchall for every purchase they make - whether it be rope, rations, healing potions, or less common items.

After a while, these settings can bet glossed over because they are expected and no longer represent a place of opportunity, a way to meet interesting townsfolk, a way to scratch their particular interests, and a way to really immerse themselves into the town experience.

Town Builder solves these problems by letting you turn your town into a bustling region of commerce and creativity in seconds!

Town Builder is a collection of 50+ unique medieval and ancient businesses (some mundane, some magical, and some in between) that you can drop into your fantasy ttrpg setting and use instantly. 

This way, you can send you team of adventurers to a  miller instead of the general store to gather some provisions. Or have them visit a butcher and tanner to process the spoils of a recent hunt in a nearby forest. Or have them visit a candle maker for candles. The possibilities for expanded role play in a richly fleshed out town or city are endless - and Town Builder makes the process quick and simple for the busy game master. 

Note: Town Builder does not have a tavern, blacksmith shop, inn, trading post, temple, or general store. Each is a specialty business more in line with what people living in ancient times dealt with a on a daily basis.

What's Inside

Town Builder is an 8.5"x11" black and white product that will include over 50 businesses and trades. Each entry will include the following details:

  • Name of the business.
  • Description of the business - including some historical details and alternate names that the business might have been called at various times in history.
  • Description of the owner in enough detail that you can easily roleplay them.
  • Worker descriptions when appropriate. This can include apprentices or helpers. Not all businesses will have workers. 
  • Several rumors the party can learn through conversations with the owner and workers.
  • A quest seed that the owner would love to hire a group to undertake. Some will be simple, others offer the opportunity to spin off a full-fledged side quest.
  • Items for sale with prices based on the 5e pricing scale.

The book is available in PDF and POD softcover and hardcover formats. Depending on the number of businesses, it will be somewhere between 100 and 150 pages. Based on that size, the cost to print for those who select the POD option will be approximately $5 for the softcover or $10 for the hardcover depending on the final page count. If the page count is higher, the cost will be a bit greater.

Make suggestions

I've only provided a partial list of the businesses that will be included in this drop-in campaign builder to give, your backers, a chance to share your input. I invite you to send a message with ideas for types of businesses & trades you'd like to see in the guide. While I can't promise to include them all, I'll definitely use those that fit into the product. 

Stretch Goals

For every $500 in pledges, one additional unique business will be added to the project.

UNLOCKED Additionally, if Town Builder reaches $5,000 in pledges, an additional section will be added to showcase the myriad government positions (from mayor to rat catcher) with detailed descriptions of their functions plus an NPC currently holding each position.

Add-ons

Several of my prior kickstarters and a few other projects are available as add-ons. There are either one or two pledge tiers for each - PDF only, or PDF a a coupon to buy a print on demand version from DriveThruRPG at their print & ship cost. (In the instance where a book has both paperback and hardcover versions, the pledge for PDF & POD gets two coupons, one for each print versions.) The FAQ shares the approximate print cost for each book.

  • Pru's Potions and Poisons Alchemy Shop - is designed to be a drop-in setting for any ttrpg city or town. It is a place for your adventurers to shop for vital supplies, both mundane and magical, interact with interesting people (and perhaps even Paulie the Poltergeist), and discover interesting rumors swirling around the shop, city, and about alchemical mysteries in your game world. $9 PDF. $13 PDF and POD (print-on-demand) code. (Plus an estimated $7 for softcover or $12 for hardcover printing cost and shipping cost paid to DriveThruRPG. You get both POD codes when  you pledge at the PDF & POD level.)
  • Rigo’s Register of Roguish Quests– a collection of  adventures and quests that focus on the resident rogue and their skills.  Building a campaign around your favorite thief allows them to shine, to  be the center of attention for a change rather than the one who is  always called to the front of the line because a lock needs to be picked  and somewhat ignored when it’s time for the heavy fighting against  skilled enemies. $4 PDF. $7 PDF and POD (print-on-demand) code. (Plus an estimated $3 printing cost and shipping cost paid to DriveThruRPG.)
  • Bezmel's Bazaar of Baubles and Bemusements Deluxe Edition - is a robust outdoor bazaar designed to work with any tabletop fantasy role-playing game. This comprehensive resource gives you, the game master, all the details you need for running a bazaar of shops, entertainment, services, and plenty of mysteries and rumors in your campaigns. Bezmel's is written to work with any tabletop role-playing game. $15 PDF. $20 PDF and POD (print-on-demand) code.(Plus an estimated $8 for softcover or $13 for hardcover printing cost and shipping cost paid to DriveThruRPG. You get both POD codes when  you pledge at the PDF & POD level.) 
  • The City of Ganelor is a robust city designed to work with any  tabletop fantasy role-playing game. This comprehensive resource gives  you, the game master, all the details you need for running a large town or city in your campaigns. Ganelor is written to work with any tabletop  role-playing game. Ganelor has enough variety, shops, plot hooks, rumors, and potential  NPC  interaction opportunities to be useful for any duration campaign – from just a few weeks to years of gameplay. In fact, Ganelor makes an excellent home base for your player characters in your game world - giving them a rich area to explore and detailed NPCs for beneficial relationships as adventures unfold. $12 PDF. $17 PDF and POD (print-on-demand) code. (Plus an estimated $6 printing cost and shipping cost paid to DriveThruRPG.)
  • Marvelous and Arcane Magic Items for the Busy Game Master,  a 160+ page 8.5"x11" black & white book created to give you, the  game master, 1,000 choices of interesting and  unexpected magic items to  offer your players. Many of the magic items are written in game  agnostic form but a few reference 5e rules. $12 PDF. $17 PDF and POD (print-on-demand) code. (Plus an estimated $7 printing cost and shipping cost paid to DriveThruRPG.)
  • Ty'inks Treasury of Traps details 140+ traps  over almost 100 8.x"x11" black & white pages to get you started. It  is broken into five main sections: corridors, doors, rooms,  items, and  miscellaneous. But don’t let the categories limit you. Each  trap is  easily twisted to fit another environment. A little imagination  goes a  long way to creating unique scenarios that will delight your  players. $12 PDF. $17 PDF and POD (print-on-demand) code. (Plus an estimated $5 printing cost and shipping cost paid to DriveThruRPG.)
  • Tavern Tables: The Game Master’s Tavern Builder Handbook is the definitive guide to creating and running taverns in your  role-playing game. Combine bits and pieces from its dozens of tables and  you will soon have a fully fleshed-out tavern for your players to  explore. From food to drink to songs to the atmosphere, this guide has  everything you could ever look for. It even has fully fleshed-out  taverns for an even quicker start. $9 PDF. $14 PDF and POD (print-on-demand) code. (Plus an estimated $6 printing cost and shipping cost paid to DriveThruRPG.)
  • Town Tables: The Game Master’s Town Builder Handbook is the definitive guide to creating and running towns in your  role-playing game. Combine bits and pieces from its 100+ tables and you  will soon have a fully fleshed-out immersive town setting for your  players to explore. From tavern food and drink menus to NPCs to  interesting shop items to atmosphere, this guide has everything you  could ever look for. $9 PDF. (No print copy is available at this time.)
  • Dungeon Tables: The Game Master’s Dungeon Builder Handbook is the definitive guide to creating and running dungeons in your  role-playing game. Combine bits and pieces from its 50+ tables and you  will soon have a fully fleshed-out immersive dungeon setting for your  players to explore. From construction materials to treasures to  interesting artifacts decorating the rooms and corridors to the  atmosphere, this guide has everything you could ever look for. $9 PDF. (No print copy is available at this time.)

nodes.name: DnD 5e One Shots of Ethelon Vol 7 - Epic Stories of the Past
nodes.risks: Since this is passion project for us, we made sure everything is ready beforehand. We only need to add some finishing touches, which will occur while the campaign is running, and when surveys are completed and payment checks out you will receive the module(s) of your choice!
nodes.story:
D&D 5e One Shots Vol 7 - Epic Stories of the Past is the 7th installment in an exciting project brought to you by Adventure Ripples! The goal of this project is to provide quality thematic One-Shots, taking place in the world of Ethelon, designed to minimize GM prep and be playable in a single seating! 

Our goal was to release 6 volumes in 2023, which we did, and we will be providing a 7th (and last for a long time as new and exciting things are coming), closing out this cycle of projects! We hope this series was as enjoyable for you as it was for us.

Each One-Shot is an original, PDF-only 5e adventure for the GM who wants something exciting on the fly that is easy to pick up and play! The key word with these adventures is flexibility, meaning that you can play them as stand-alone adventures, or they can easily be integrated into your current campaign.

Each adventure is presented in a standard, universal format, designed for a 4-5 hour game.

Each PDF includes:

  • Introduction
  • Hook
  • GM Tips and Notes
  • Story
  • 2 Maps (GM's map, Player's map)
  • Encounters
  • Traps
  • Treasures
  • Monster Appendix

There are also Stretch Goals (see below)!

We are located in the magical world of Ethelon. It is a place where beasts fall and heroes emerge. The goal was to slowly reveal the world map, and it looks like we are finally there! Behold, the world of Ethelon. 

We also have the ambition of creating a campaign in 2024 based on some of the adventures and their aftermath.

To differentiate the installments, each volume features a different theme. This month's volume (January 2024) will feature Epic Stories of the Past, which includes Stories that dive into the history of Ethelon!


This to us is the introduction for the projects to come, that have the intention of fleshing out the amazing setting of Ethelon!

In the quiet town of Orilon, a mysterious threat emerges as the monks of a secluded monastery fall victim to a brutal attack. The town's trade connection with the monks, overseen by the boisterous Angus Brewdin, is disrupted when a desperate female, Ilyona Hinode, seeks to unearth a hidden gate beneath the monastery that connects the world of the living with the world of the dead.

Guided by an ordinary quest, the adventurers end up delving into the monastery's catacombs to stop a world changing event from happening, and disrupting life on Ethelon as we know it.

Günther, a lively dwarf brewmaster in the town of Lito, seeks the players' aid in securing a rare and elusive ingredient, which he insists is the key to a secret recipe—the formula for the best beer ever. Günther believes this exceptional ingredient, known as the "Yellow Aroxen," can be found in abundance within the ancient ruins of a long-forgotten Dwarven fortress.

The adventure kicks off as Günther warmly invites the players to his renowned brewery, "Günther's Goblet." There, he shares the lore surrounding the ruins and the mysterious Yellow Aroxen. Recognizing the dangers of the journey, Günther assures the group that the risks will be met with generous rewards. Additionally, he tantalizes the adventurers with the promise of valuable treasures awaiting them in the expedition to this concealed location.

What neither Günther nor the players know is that these forgotten ruins hold a dark secret—forgotten for a good reason. Something ancient and malevolent slumbers within.

Intrigued by the enigmatic fall of the once-glorious city of Elmon'dar and the mysterious death of its last king, Voss Strain, the party decides to embark on an epic journey through the annals of history.

As they traverse the vibrant streets and markets of Elmon'dar in its prime, the adventurers witness the city's prosperity and the revered rule of King Voss Strain. However,  signs of unrest and whispers of betrayal begin to surface. The constant external threat of the primordials leads King Voss to consider extreme measures to deal with the issue.

The party's quest becomes a race against time as they strive to prevent the impending catastrophe that led to the city's demise and the tragic fate of King Voss Strain.

In the heart of Ethelon, near the town of Andethor, an ancient druidic artifact holds the power to awaken the long-slumbering primordial spirit of nature, transforming the world into an untamed wilderness.

Alaion Wynfaren Tinleaf, a Wood Elf Druid devoted to fighting against the ravage of nature, stumbles upon this artifact during his extensive studies of the wilderness. However, the coveted item is snatched from his grasp by a trusted colleague. Despite Alaion's commitment to a druidic circle dedicated to combating the ravages of nature, he grapples with the dilemma of whether unleashing such an uncontrollable force is the righteous path.

He decides to seek help in getting the artifact back, to seal it once and for all, as his firm belief is that disturbing the balance of nature, even if it is for the cause he supports, is not something that he wants to be part of.

As soon as the surveys are completed and the payment checks out, you will immediately receive the adventures in PDF format! The project will be fulfilled through DrivethruRPG.

POD LINKS for Softcover orders AVAILABLE!

Since a lot of you enjoy professionally printed material, you can now get a POD link to print a collection of our adventures as a softcover through DrivethroughRPG!

Backers of those Add-Ons will receive codes to get a physical version of our Volumes 1-2, Volumes 3-4 and Volumes 5-6 Adventures. These codes are at cost, which means that you pay later to DrivethruRPG only for the manufacturing and shipping costs (we don't get any extra money from this).

Printing Cost: It depends on the number of pages, and each collection is about 110 pages, an estimate should be about 7.23€/ 7.9$ for the printing cost.

Shipping Cost: It depends on your country of choice! Please check DrivethruRPG.com for more info on the topic.

6 €: Horrors Unleased: 20 Monsters for DnD 5e (PDF): Our Backerkit project, featuring 20 creatures that will challenge your players' skills and ignite their imaginations!

13€: Adventures of Ethelon Volume 1 - Dangers of the Forest (PDF): Our 1st Project, featuring 4 One-Shots in the Forest!

13€: Adventures of Ethelon Volume 2 - Mountain Madness (PDF): Our 2nd Project, featuring 4 One-Shots in the Mountains!

36€: (POD link) Adventures of Ethelon Volume 1-2 in PDF + Softcover! SHIPPING AND PRINTING COST NOT INCLUDED.

13€: Adventures of Ethelon Volume 4 - Underwater Adventures (PDF): Our 4th Project, featuring 4 One-Shots underwater!

36€: (POD link) Adventures of Ethelon Volume 3-4 in PDF + Softcover! SHIPPING AND PRINTING COST NOT INCLUDED.

13€: Adventures of Ethelon Volume 5 - Solving a Murder (PDF): Our 5th Project, featuring 4 Murder-Solving One-Shots!

13€: Adventures of Ethelon Volume 6 - Extreme Cold Expeditions (PDF): Our 6th Project, featuring 4 One-Shots in the freezing cold!

36€: (POD link) Adventures of Ethelon Volume 5-6 in PDF + Softcover! SHIPPING AND PRINTING COST NOT INCLUDED.

We are a team of veteran tabletop RPG players that have decided to share our work with the community. We have done so in the past through Dmsguild.com, some of our works even reaching Gold Seller!

Into the Temple of the Yuan-Ti

We have been playing 5e since the release of DND Next and fell in love with it. After some discussions we have decided to launch this group project, expanding monthly over 2023. We are very excited to share our ideas with you and we cannot wait to hear your thoughts about it!

nodes.name: DIVINE GUARDIAN
nodes.risks:
Playable Demo: Our second demo, covering 20% of 'Vệ Thần/ Divine Guardian', is live. It's a solid indicator of our progress and helps us refine the final game.

Project Completion: With 10 months of development already behind us, we're confident about completing the project. However, unexpected events might affect our timeline.

Potential Delays: We're aiming for an early 2025 release. But, as game development can be unpredictable, there's a possibility of needing more time to ensure the game meets our quality standards.

We're committed to transparency and will keep our backers informed every step of the way.
nodes.story:
Divine Guardian - Vệ Thần is the first-ever Vietnamese-style Metroidvania, created by Young Buffalo Games. We've come together with a dedicated goal: to bring Vietnam's epic history and vibrant culture into video games.

  • Divine Guardian takes inspiration from classics like Hollow Knight, Dead Cells, and Ori, offering players a 2D hand-drawn Metroidvania world of intricate gameplay and visual artistry.
  • Players immerse themselves in the world of Vietnamese mythology, weaving a captivating narrative inspired by Vietnam's legends, offering a thrilling exploration of an entirely new world
  • Encounter deities and characters inspired from ancient folktales and legends. Learn their story and help them with different quests
  • Engaging in combat using a diverse array of weapons, charms, spells, and magic, allowing for creative combinations and fostering a rich, varied, and exciting gameplay experience
  • Featuring an intriguing open-world design, the game offers a non-linear experience that allows players with freedom to explore and create their own unique storyline.

A VIET-MYTHOLOGY WORLD

Immersed in the rich tapestry of Vietnamese mythology and folklore, the game's world is a vivid tapestry of fairytale characters, mythical gods, and mystical creatures. 

Players are granted a unique opportunity to venture into this enchanting realm, delving deep into its colorful narratives and traditions. The development team takes immense pride in showcasing the cultural richness and mythological depth of Vietnam, offering players a captivating journey that celebrates the nation's heritage.

LORE AND STORY

In a world where humans once coexisted harmoniously under the protection of benevolent gods, shielding them from malevolent demons and spirits, a mysterious calamity known as the Ruination Day struck. Suddenly, all the gods vanished without a trace, leaving humanity to face a bleak existence devoid of magic and divine protection.

Now surrounded by lurking demons and spectral entities, the humans find themselves in desperate need of salvation. Who will rise as their beacon of hope in these dire times?

THE PROTAGONIST 

The Divine Guardian's origins remain shrouded in mystery, emerging from an ancient seal with no memory of his past. Driven by an enigmatic spiritual quest, he embarks on a journey to uncover his own story and purpose. 

As he navigates this fantastical realm, seeking answers to its enigmas, the unfolding narrative holds the promise of revelations and transformations, leaving players eager to discover the fate that awaits both The Divine Guardian and the world he inhabits within the game.

EXPLORATION: DISCOVER 5 AREAS ACCROSS THE REALM

In Divine Guardian, the meticulously crafted world is segmented into distinct regions, each offering a unique and captivating exploration experience. Every region is accompanied by its own intricately designed map, characterized by diverse environments and gameplay mechanics, ensuring a rich and varied gameplay journey.

NON-LINEAR PROGRESSION  

Embracing the essence of the Metroidvania genre, the game fosters an environment where players can freely explore and find their own path. Players may discover hidden rooms, breakable walls, locked doors, or uncharted pathways—each detail adding intrigue and allowing the game to branch in various directions.

With each playthrough, a completely new storyline unfolds, presenting endless possibilities and outcomes, ensuring that no two journeys are ever the same.

The narrative you experience will be entirely unique. Pay close attention as you play, for we may have secrets hidden just out of sight. Always stay vigilant and observant, for mysteries await, meticulously hidden for those keen enough to uncover them.

COMBAT

In our game, combat is at the forefront, with a focus on responsive controls that ensure smooth and intuitive gameplay. The dynamic combat system offers thrilling battles against monsters, keeping players engaged and challenged throughout.

A standout feature of the game is its diverse weapon system, offering players a wide array of weapons to choose from. Additionally, players have the ability to wield two weapons simultaneously, allowing for a multitude of combinations and combos. Alongside this, the charm system shines as it provides players with various beneficial features and conveniences to complement the combat experience.

SERVICES AND UTILITIES

In the game, various services and utilities are available to assist players throughout their journey. There are merchants selling maps, others offering useful items, and a range of different services to cater to players' needs. And guess what? All these characters are all inspired by legends and fairy tales, adding a touch of enchantment to the game.

CHARACTERS AND NPCs

In a world teeming with magics, Characters and NPCs play an important role, they are crucial to breathe vibrancy and depth into the game's universe. These characters and NPCs are not mere background figures; they are meticulously crafted entities, each with their own unique backstory, quests, and life journeys. Every character you encounter has a narrative waiting to be unraveled, quests waiting to be embarked upon, and secrets waiting to be unveiled.

They serve as the backbone of the world, enriching the gameplay experience by offering diverse interactions, challenges, and stories. As you navigate through the game, these characters stand as testament to the intricacies and intricacies of the world, beckoning you to engage, explore, and discover the myriad tales they hold.

More pledges equal more bonus content to enhance the game experience! The more support we get, the more stuff we provide!

Don't miss out on these fantastic rewards! Support us on Kickstarter to bring this captivating exploration video game, inspired by vibrant Vietnamese mythologies, to life.

Join us on this exciting journey of making the first ever metroidvania. 

  • We're a dedicated indie studio who've invested our personal funds into developing this game.
  • Your contributions will accelerate development, allowing us to focus on enhancing the game's quality.
  • With additional funding, we can enrich the game with superior sound effects and more comprehensive content, ensuring a top-notch experience at launch.

We left our previous jobs to form our studio to make Vietnamese-theme games. We believe our culture is diversified, colorful & contented, they are good material to make great games & stories.

nodes.name: 100 Unique Locations for D&D 5e!
nodes.risks: The project is close to ready so there is no risk involved and all files will be digital.
nodes.story:
100 Unique Locations for D&D 5e! is a brand new 100+ page tome for 5th edition of the world's most famous role-playing game, but can be easily integrated into various other systems. Guide your players through breathtaking locations with plot hooks, conflicts, atmospheric descriptions, and much more! You can plug-and-play these locations in an ongoing adventure or campaign or use them as starting points to expand upon.

Embark on a journey of imagination with your players as you explore these locations that span various genres and themes, presenting many deadly and rewarding challenges. Each location is designed to be conscise yet packed with narrative potential so that it can be easily added to your current game.

Contents: 

Many campaigns tend to have similar locations and encounter settings, which can make them a little bland to long-time experienced players. So, when a quick spicing up is needed, plugging in an unique location can be a great way to make things more interesting and engaging for both the players and the Dungeon Master. 

Each location is presented with a detailed yet concise description, capturing its overall atmosphere and special features. To enhance the adventure, exciting hooks are provided, making each visit to these locations a memorable experience. These hooks are designed to introduce challenges, potential combat encounters, and remarkable interactions, ensuring that each location offers a unique and engaging element to your campaign.

The locations will be set in a range of diverse biomes:

  • Deserts
  • Beaches
  • Forests
  • Tundra
  • Swamps
  • Underdark
  • Mountains
  • And More!

Free Playtest Materials!

Dive into the locations early! 

100 Unique Locations for 5e - Playtest Preview Version [Download Link]!

                                                    Example Page

Stretch Goals

If we receive at least 50 comments from different backers, each sharing their most interesting and unique locations—whether current, past, or future—everyone will receive an additional location as a bonus. We are also eager to hear your feedback on these pages and your thoughts about them. Your insights are invaluable to us, and we appreciate your active participation and engagement in enhancing this project.

In addition to the comments, for every $1,500 gathered, we will add one more location to the final Kickstarter exclusive product!

Add-Ons

nodes.description: Carve your own fate with this remastered version of Norse fantasy Soulslike tabletop roleplaying game Runecairn.

environmentalCommitments.description: Standart Impressa utilises the newest technology and a team of skilled professionals to work thoughtfully and efficiently, providing an ecological printing process and reducing paper waste to a minimum.

nodes.question: What's different in Remastered? Why should I get this if I've got the original Wardensaga?
nodes.answer:
If you want a deluxe quality hardcover copy with a killer new cover and refined rules, then the Remastered is for you!

- Sleek new layout, making it clearer to read and play.
- Tightened up and clarified mechanics, to better convey to new players and GMs.
- Brought in new mechanics introduced in the Runecairn Bestiary like toxic and dismembered status effects.
- Provided answers to common questions like "how do I increase mead flask sips?", "what do rare items mean?", and "where should I place bonfires when playing solo?".
- Brilliant new colour and texture for the illustrations, alongside all new illustrations like the dwarf and lindworm.
- Typo and corrections pass to squash those bugs once and for all.

A full changelog is available in the campaign description.

Of course, you can always keep your existing copy of Wardensaga and it'll be 100% compatible with all new Runecairn adventures (coming soon)!

nodes.question: Why make a new version of Wardensaga?
nodes.answer:
The original version was created by me (Colin Le Sueur) and co-published by Exalted Funeral, who printed the original release and own the original cover by CROM. 

I wanted to be able to print my own copies and have more control over Wardensaga, hence published the new, Remastered version.

nodes.question: Is Runecairn compatible with Cairn, We Deal in Lead, or other Into the Odd-based games?
nodes.answer:
Broadly speaking, yes! 

Runecairn is based on Into the Odd and Cairn, sharing many similar rules and mechanics. You can run adventures designed for Cairn and Into the Odd (along with other Odd descendants like Mausritter, Liminal Horror, and We Deal in Lead) with Runecairn adventurers, though there are some guidelines to bear in mind.

You can read more about conversions and compatibility on the Runecairn website:

https://runecairn.byodinsbeardrpg.com/compatibility/

nodes.question: Can I get the updated PDF if I already own the physical version?
nodes.answer: Absolutely! Just drop me an email (colin@byodinsbeardrpg.com) with info about where you bought it and I'll sort it. Updated PDFs will go out after the campaign ends.

nodes.question: Can I play Runecairn with more than 1 player?
nodes.answer:
Absolutely! While the game was built for 1 Warden and 1 Adventurer, you've got a couple of options, some of which are covered inside Runecairn Wardensaga. If you have additional players that play once and awhile, you can use the summoning mechanic to summon a new hero into the world and fight alongside the adventurer. If the adventurer dies, the summoned ally disappears back to their world. You can also run this as an invasion, if your players enjoy PVP.

Alternately, you can also run with a standard group of adventurers. I ran a group of 3 adventurers recently (video link here: https://youtu.be/l9xNXw9tnmw?si=i6FP3X1Q5b95Xmla) and had no issues.

The only sticky part is how to deal with death and bonfire respawning. The Warden might decide to say that if one adventurer dies, the remaining characters keep fighting and have the dead hero respawn after combat ends. Alternately, the adventurer could run back from the bonfire to attempt to rejoin the fight.

The beauty of Into the Odd and Cairn-based systems (like Runecairn) is they easily scale for multiple players.

nodes.name: Runecairn Wardensaga Remastered
nodes.risks:
Runecairn Wardensaga Remastered is 95% complete. The book is written and layout is complete. Editing and typo-squashing are being finalised as the campaign runs. The only remaining piece is the new cover art.

The only risks are related to delays in international shipping. However, the printer is established and well-regarded firm that I've worked with previously and who've delivered with excellent quality and professionalism.
nodes.story:
Strap on your bearded axe and linden wood shield, delve into the forsaken barrow and cleanse the draugr within. They will overwhelm you at first so prepare to die. But when you wake up at the bonfire, you'll know what to expect for your next attempt. Parry their attacks, disarm them, and hack them to pieces. Defeat the undead within and claim the soul remnant they protect.

DEATH IS NOT THE END

Download the free Quickstart and create a dynamic Viking adventurer now!

Runecairn is a Norse fantasy tabletop roleplaying game written and designed by Colin Le Sueur and inspired by games like Dark Souls and Elden Ring. Based on lightweight new school revolution (NSR) systems Into the Odd and Cairn, Runecairn is designed for 2 players, one GM (the Warden) and one player (the Adventurer).

Runecairn Wardensaga Remastered is an 84-page full-colour hardcover filled with black and white and colour illustrations depicting the Norse fantasy world of the Nine Realms.

This book contains everything you need to run the game, from a quick one-shot, short dungeon delve, or epic campaign, including:

  • Streamlined d20 roll-under rules based on Cairn and Into the Odd.
  • Soulslike mechanics such as resurrecting at bonfires, respawning monsters, and dynamic combat.
  • Quickstart dungeon crawl adventure Beneath the Broken Sword, perfect for new GMs and players.
  • 4 standard backgrounds: the hearty Warrior, nimble Scout, cunning Seer, or spirited Skald.
  • 2 new advanced backgrounds: the devastating Berserkr and fiery Pyre.
  • Solo play with a rune-based oracle.
  • Delve generator for randomly creating dark fantasy dungeons.
  • Drop-in additional players for jolly cooperation or player-vs-player invasions.

Download a free 18-page Quickstart now and sink your teeth into:

  • Adventurer creation and example
  • Backgrounds
  • Combat example
  • Monsters
  • Character sheet

Remastered is an updated and refreshed version of the original Runecairn: Wardensaga, published in 2022.

What's different in Wardensaga Remastered?

  • Sleek new layout, making it clearer to read and play.
  • Tightened up and clarified mechanics, to better convey to new players and GMs.
  • Brought in new mechanics introduced in the Runecairn Bestiary like toxic and dismembered status effects.
  • Provided answers to common questions like "how do I increase mead flask sips?", "what do rare items mean?", and "where should I place bonfires when playing solo?".
  • Brilliant new colour and texture for the illustrations, alongside all new illustrations like the dwarf and lindworm.
  • Typo and corrections pass to squash those bugs once and for all.

Download the full changelog here.

In the wondrous beauty of the aftermath,
Golden tables found among the grass,
Held by the gods in days of old.
Then barren fields will bloom and grow,
All harm shall be undone.
—Voluspá, 61-62

Runecairn is set in a world following the cataclysmic events of Ragnarok, an apocalyptic battle between the gods and the jotunn. In the aftermath, the Nine Realms burn in fire and drown in flood. Most of the gods are either dead or missing and the ruins of the old world are lost to time and new growth.

You are an Adventurer, reborn into this new world after living and dying in the old. You are untethered from the skein of fate, free to carve your own destiny. Who you were before does not limit who you can become.

Built from the streamlined rules of Into the Odd and Cairn, Runecairn is designed for 2 players, one Warden (GM) and one Adventurer (the player). Character creation is lightning fast, with 4 standard backgrounds to choose from along with 2 advanced backgrounds.

Backgrounds

  • The Warrior: You might have been a soldier, a guardsman, a shieldmaiden, or a raider. Your shield was always strapped to your arm and your axe and spear always to hand.
  • The Skald: You might have spoken for the dead, burned sweet sacrifices to the gods, wandered the land weaving tales of myth and legend.
  • The Scout: You might have been a hunter, an archer, a scoundrel, or an explorer. With a pair of sharp knives and a trusty shortbow, you easily made your way in the world, whether in untamed wilderness or cut-throat civilisation.
  • The Seer: You might have been a wise woman, an augur, a trickster, or a conjurer. The only things you needed were your wits and a hunger for knowledge. You sought to delve the mysteries of the realms and pluck forth the secrets within.
  • The Berserkr: You might have leaped raging into battle, striking fear in friend and foe alike, or hunted the wilderness for death and glory. You refused all armour and blood sang in your ears.
  • The Pyre: You might have burned spirits from the dead, stoked the smithy’s forge, or battled frost demons in the mountains.

Weapon as Class

Your background provides starting equipment and skills but does not dictate your fate. Change your class by switching to a different key item. As a Warrior, you can block and parry with your shield, but if you want to become a Skald, drop your shield and grab a runic focus.

Dynamic Combat

React to enemy attacks and parry, block, dodge, or deflect before they hit. Manage fatigue and resilience to balance risk and reward, delivering devastating attacks to fearsome opponents.

Progression

Seek mighty foes to defeat and grow stronger with their Souls. Explore lost ruins dripping in demonic magic and claim the relics held within.

There are three basic pledge levels, Digital, Hardcover, and Variant Edition:

  • Hardcover (£30): Beautiful 84-page hardcover with cover art from CROM, custom endpapers, head and tail bands, and sewn stitching. Includes the above PDFs.

And five bundles:

In addition, you get an Odin patch, 10 printed character sheets, a set of A5 art prints, and your name will be carved into the skein of fate (inside Wardensaga Remastered). This reward is perfect for those who already have the Runecairn Bestiary but want the bundled goodies.
  • Adventurer Bundle (£100): Includes everything in the Warrior Bundle, along with the Runecairn Bestiary hardcover.

Includes a copy of the standard hardcover (with CROM cover), the fully painted variant hardcover (with the Blue Fern Arts cover), the Runecairn Bestiary hardcover, the Odin patch, the Runecairn patch, 10 printed character sheets, a set of A5 art prints, and your name will be carved into the skein of fate (inside Wardensaga Remastered). As well, every book is signed by Colin Le Sueur.

If you pledge at the Hardcover tier or above within the first 24 hours, you get a free Runecairn patch!

The patch will be also available as an add-on.

Retailers, whether online or brick and mortar, have a separate tier:

  • Merchant (£15): Are you an online retailer or brick and mortar shop and want to stock Runecairn Wardensaga Remastered? This tier registers your interest with a deposit of 1 copy, allowing you to place a wholesale order at a later date. The minimum order is 5 hardcover copies, sold at wholesale price (£15 each).
  • Runecairn patch (£5): 75mm embroidered iron-on patch in yellow and black, depicting a Runecairn bonfire and surrounded by the word Runecairn translated into Old Norse in Younger Futhark runes. This patch is included for free for anyone pledging on day 1 at the Hardcover level and above.
  • Odin patch (£5): 75mm embroidered iron-on patch in white, black, and yellow, depicting Odin in a Viking Age art style. This patch is included for free in the Hardcover Bundle, Variant Bundle, Warrior Bundle, Adventurer Bundle, Warden Bundle, and Nine Realms Bundle tiers.
  • Runecairn character sheets: Standard character sheet on the front and expanded character information on the reverse, including character history, description and personality, motivation, and a blank grid for mapping or items. Printed on quality 120gsm recycled paper.
  • Set of A5 Runecairn prints: A selection of the amazing cover art from Runecairn in 5 A5 prints, including the covers of Runecairn Core Rules, Runecairn Advanced Rules, Bestiary, Runecairn Wardensaga Remastered, and Runecairn Wardensaga Remastered Variant.
  • £6000 (UNLOCKED): Runecairn Wardensaga Remastered reaches funding.
  • £8000 (UNLOCKED): The hardcover is upgraded with a deluxe yellow bookmark ribbon.
  • £12000: I'll release Into the Nine Realms, a PDF collection of 1-page Runecairn dungeons: 16 quick adventures perfect for one-shots or to drop into a longer campaign. The PDF will be included for all backers.
  • £16000: Interior art for Into the Nine Realms. The 1-page dungeons have cartography by me but I'm commissioning extra illustrations from the legendary Felipe Faria to depict some of the dangerous encounters the adventurers run into.
  • £20000: Into the Nine Realms becomes a printed zine and will be included for free in all physical pledges.

Writer/Designer: Colin Le Sueur (he/him) is a writer, artist, and dungeon master. Born in Canada, he currently makes his home in North Yorkshire in the United Kingdom. Colin publishes tabletop roleplaying games, adventures, and supplements under the name By Odin’s Beard RPG.

  • Website: https://byodinsbeardrpg.com
  • Newsletter: https://newsletter.byodinsbeardrpg.com
  • DriveThruRPG: https://www.drivethrurpg.com/browse/pub/15858/By-Odins-Beard
  • Itch.io: https://byodinsbeardrpg.itch.io

Cover Illustrator: CROM is an enigmatic artist and tattooer from London. His newest comic, Birdking Vol 2, is now available.

Website: https://bio.site/CROM

Variant Cover Illustrator: Annemieke van Barlingen is a Belgium-based traditional artist and illustrator.

Website: https://www.bluefernarts.com/

Viking Age Illustrations: Jonas Lau Markussen (he/they) is an artist and designer, specialising in Viking Age art.

Website: https://jonaslaumarkussen.com

Additional Illustrations: Kim Diaz Holm(he/they) is a Norwegian artist and anarchist.

Website: https://beacons.ai/denungeherrholm

Additional Illustrations: Felipe da Silva Fariais a Brazilian artist.

Itch Page: https://felipemuky.itch.io/

This work was made by humans. No AI or Machine Generated works are included in this project. Supporting this project means you are supporting real human beings who live, breathe, and die.

Chris McDowall (@Bastionland), designer and creator of Into the Odd and Mythic Bastionland:

I absolutely love Runecairn! As soon as I read it I wanted to steal its ideas. It changed the way I think about the type of games that the Into the Odd system can run.

Rich August (@RpgAugust), designer and writer at Steamforged Games (Dark Souls: The Roleplaying Game):

Thank you for such an awesome game - I loved reading Runecairn and it’s on my list of games to get to the table. And the layout is lovely too.

Richard Kelly (@SprintingOwl), designer:

If you're looking for a moderately crunchy duo TRPG, or if you're a fan of Souls games, or if you want to see a stellar adaptation of video game mechanics to tabletop, I would strongly recommend giving Beneath the Broken Sword (and Runecairn) a shot.

Review of Runecairn Wardensaga from The Weekly Scroll:

Roll 4 Initiative:

I sat down recently with The Weekly Scroll to discuss Wardensaga Remastered and run the gang (plus Jon from Sivad's Sanctum) through a randomly generated cave delve, built using Wardensaga and some monsters from the Bestiary.

See Runecairn Wardensaga in action with one Warden and one Adventurer (via PlusOneExp):

See a solo playthrough of the introductory adventure Beneath the Broken Sword (via StoneAxe Tabletop Gaming:

  • By Odin's Beard RPG Discord: Join the discussion to talk about Runecairn, We Deal in Lead, and other projects from Colin Le Sueur.
  • Runecairn character sheet: Download the Runecairn character sheet for free here, which includes a form-fillable PDF and printer-friendly version.
  • Character generator: Generate an adventurer in seconds!
  • Dark Souls (video game series, 2012-2016).
  • Cairn by Yochai Gal (TTRPG, 2020).
  • Into the Odd by Chris McDowall (TTRPG, 2015-2022).
  • American Gods by Neil Gaiman (novel, 2001).
  • Sagas of Icelanders (c. 1200-1400 CE).

First and foremost, Runecairn is a love letter to Dark Souls. Starting life as my version of a Dark Souls TTRPG, I took inspiration from Norse myths and legends in Icelandic Sagas like the Poetic Edda, Prose Edda, and Voluspá, along with the more contemporary representations of Norse gods in American Gods, which shows how belief changes gods over time and how all myths are malleable.

Mechanically, Runecairn is closest to Cairn, with me bringing my love of crunch to make combat more tactical and dynamic, and closer to an actual Soulslike. Working on Runecairn gave me enough experience to write for the official Dark Souls RPG, which was a dream come true!

Runecairn Bestiary is a 64-page tabletop RPG supplement for Norse fantasy roleplaying game Runecairn, adding 100 new monsters and rules for creating or converting even more.

The Bestiary Includes:

  • Tips on converting existing monsters from Cairn and other Into the Odd games.

nodes.story:
About the Adventure!

Story Introduction:

Set sail on the adventure of a lifetime! As the salty winds whip through your hair and the creaking timbers of your ship echo with tales of the sea, you and your party find yourselves at the heart of a gripping maritime tale.

Your every decision will be met with the watchful eyes of rival pirate crews and privateer factions. Engage in daring ship-to-ship battles, strategic espionage, and cunning diplomacy as you vie for dominance on the open seas. The race to claim the Sea Beast's bounty is on, and only the most cunning or ruthless will emerge victorious.

The choices you make will shape the destiny of your crew and the outcome of this nautical saga. Dive into the deep blue and let the waves of adventure carry you into uncharted wonders. Glory awaits – where will your compass lead you?

Adventure Stats:

  • This Adventure can be played as: a One Shot,  2-4 Play Sessions, Embedded in any Nautical Campaign, or as the second part of our Seafaring Mini-Campaign.
  • Balanced for parties of 4-5 Level 4 Player Characters
  • Compatible with Dungeons and Dragons 5e and The Black Flag Roleplaying system. 

Base Adventure Contents:

  • Recommended Adventure Hooks for Players
  • Suggestions for Spin-Off Adventures
  • Simplified Sailing and Ship-Based Combat Rules
  • Table of Sailors for Game Masters (GMs) to prepare different Crews
  • Table of Sailing Encounters for GMs to prepare Random Encounters
  • 4 NPC Stat Blocks for different Crew Members.
  • 2 New Monster Stat Blocks with suggestions for strategy and loot:
    Lobstaur Skulker & Skabikarul
  • 4 Premade Level 4 Heroes with Archetypes, Backstories, and Adventure Hooks: 
    Saviel the Cleric,  Gresh the Fighter, Cale the Rogue, and Fauni the Wizard
  • All Unlocked Stretch Goals

Free Holiday Adventure?! 

While traveling on the way to their next adventure, the party is stopped by a villager with a desperate plea! Hidden in the woods nearby is a clearing with a stone archway. Every four years, a portal appears and robed figures are said to lure people from the nearby villages into entering, but they are never seen again. She is desperate for someone to save her brother before the portal closes!

2024 brings the rare opportunity to play a Leap-Year themed adventure. Please feel free to click the image below or the link for the free PDF. We look forward to hearing about your experience! (Link to the Free PDF)

We would really appreciate it if anyone excited about Setting Sail, Temple of Time, or any of our Adventures could leave a public comment on our Kickstarter Page! Also, feel free to tag us at any of our Socials or join the Discord! LinkTree

Funding Stretch Goals!

  • UNLOCKED $700: 5 New Magic Items 
    (Preview Coming Soon!)

nodes.name: Forgotten Lore: Celtic Collections
nodes.risks: In the journey of bringing "Forgotten Lore: Celtic Collections" to life, we're committed to transparency and open communication. While we foresee no significant challenges, our dedicated team is prepared to address any unforeseen issues promptly. Our passion lies in sharing our Celtic-inspired work, ensuring every backer receives a product that reflects our commitment to quality and the rich essence of Celtic lore.
nodes.story:
Forgotten Lore: Celtic Collections is a digital TTRPG system neutral source book that immerses players in the rich tapestry of Celtic mythology and Celtic inspired adventure. This comprehensive PDF collection blends ancient worlds with an atmosphere of mystique, featuring detailed sections on unique locations, intriguing NPCs, magical weapons and armor, mysterious artifacts, and diverse spells. 

Perfect for TTRPG (like Dungeons or Dragons) enthusiasts and lore lovers, it offers an authentic journey into a world steeped in Celtic traditions and folklore.

100 One-Page Layouts:

Each page is a meticulously crafted window into a different aspect of a rich, Celtic-inspired world. Every location, from mystical towns to sacred groves, every NPC, from valiant warriors to wise sages, each weapon, armor, magical item, and spell is presented on its own distinct page with it's own history, lore, characteristics and key stats. This layout offers a concise yet comprehensive snapshot, allowing for easy integration into your gaming sessions. Each page is not just a description but a story, a piece of a grand tapestry, waiting to be explored and woven into your adventures.

20 Locations: 

Venture into realms filled with mystery and allure. Discover mystical towns where every cobblestone whispers tales of old, sacred groves alive with ancient spirits, legendary castles standing as silent sentinels of forgotten epochs, and landscapes where the very earth breathes with the echoes of ancient lore.

20 NPCs: 

Meet a tapestry of characters woven from the threads of legend and everyday life. Cross paths with warriors whose deeds are sung by bards, noble rulers whose lineage trace back to mythical times, mystical sages who guard arcane secrets, and villagers whose simple lives are interlaced with intriguing mysteries and old traditions.

20 Weapons & Armour: 

Uncover a trove of armaments steeped in magic and history. Lay hands on swords that hum with enchantments, shields emblazoned with symbols of power, and equipment that carries the aura of battles long past. Each piece tells a story of heroism, betrayal, and the art of war.

20 Magic Items: 

Delve into a world where magic infuses the mundane. Find treasures foraged from the heart of enchanted forests, potions brewed from age-old recipes that promise extraordinary effects, amulets vibrating with otherworldly energy, and artifacts whose very existence bends the fabric of reality.

20 Spells: 

Immerse yourself in the arcane as you explore a spectrum of spells. Discover offensive spells that harness the raw fury of the elements, defensive incantations that weave barriers of unseen force, healing magics that draw upon the life energy of the earth, and cunning traps ensnaring the unwary in loops of time and space.

This comprehensive collection is a treasure trove for fans and new explorers alike, providing a complete experience of our Celtic-themed world.

Check out the previous projects here:

Celtic Adventures - 150 Celtic themed quest ideas

Celtic Chronicles - 120 page Sourcebook with two unique classes

Celtic Chronicles - FREE SAMPLE

Celtic Monstrosities - 80 pages of monsters, creatures & beasts

Celtic Monstrosities  - FREE SAMPLE

Support and Delivery: 

Backers receive this rich collection as a downloadable PDF, ready to bring Celtic enchantment to your gaming table.

environmentalCommitments.description:
Digital books are immune to wear and tear, and the content itself is designed to be forever compatible with fifth edition.
The hardcover version is printed with high-quality materials that are meant to last for the decades to come.
Physical books are completely reusable and recyclable. Before recycling, please consider donating the book to a friend or a library to avoid any waste :)
We print on demand to avoid having any leftover copies. We print in both EU and USA to reduce the environmental impact resulting from shipping and distribution.

aiDisclosure.generatedByAiConsent: We have not used existing artists or artwork to create our images. All the AI-generated images we used are created with Midjourney and are then extensively edited with Photoshop.
aiDisclosure.generatedByAiDetails: In our project, we'll be using some AI-generated images that have been extensively edited in Photoshop, along with some human-made art. We plan to allocate funds to move away from this strategy and include only human-made art in our future projects eventually. We are a small team and we need more than 200 images to accompany all the creatures detailed in our manual. This is to provide an immersive experience for both Game Masters and players, while also keeping the product costs as low as possible for consumers.

nodes.question: Will the book receive any translations in the future?

nodes.question: When will the Add-Ons be delivered?
nodes.answer: Every Add-On is completely ready and will be delivered along with the PDF of "Mythological Creatures" a couple of weeks after the campaign ends, as soon as the funding process is complete.

nodes.question: Can I buy physical copies of the Add-Ons?
nodes.answer: Currently, print options are not available for the Add-Ons. However, we're excited to share that we are planning to introduce this in the future. We are in the process of evaluating print quality from various printing houses to ensure we can deliver the best possible product. We expect to have this option available in the upcoming months, likely around May or June, following the shipping of "Mythological Creatures". Once the print-on-demand option becomes available, we will send a discount code for the print copies to everyone who already owns the PDF versions.

nodes.story:
Embark on an epic journey with Mythological Creatures, a monster compendium featuring over 350 pages and 300 monster statblocks specifically designed for 5E. Drawing inspiration from legends and myths across the world, this extensive collection brings to life a wide array of legendary beasts and mythical entities. Each entry provides not only detailed statblocks but also background information to integrate these beings seamlessly into your campaign.

Whether you seek to challenge your heroes with cunning tricksters from Norse sagas, confront them with fearsome monsters from Greek epics, or enchant them with mystical beings from Asian folklore, Mythological Creatures has it all. This tome serves as an invaluable resource for Game Masters looking to add a touch of the mythical to their adventures. Experience the thrill of facing legendary creatures that have captivated human imagination for centuries. The odyssey ahead awaits!

This manual offers an extensive collection of mythological creatures that can be incorporated into any campaign, regardless of its connection to specific mythological themes. The statblocks presented in this manual, drawn from a multitude of global mythologies, are envisioned to enhance the diversity and depth of any fantasy world. This eclectic array mirrors the inherent blending of elements in many worlds and settings, where influences from various cultures and mythologies coexist harmoniously. For instance, a Cetus can prove to be a formidable foe in a naval adventure, while a Tengu could be a mysterious ally in an urban intrigue.
Mythological Creatures: A Monster Compendium for 5E also provides a solid foundation for campaigns that wish to delve deeper into the realms of a specific mythology or even blend multiple mythologies. A campaign set in a world inspired by Greek mythology could have players embarking on odysseys akin to those of ancient heroes, facing creatures like the Minotaur or Medusa, while a campaign drawing from Hindu mythology could involve epic battles against Asuras and encounters with fierce Nagas. For a more comprehensive approach, Game Masters can craft a world where mythologies collide, creating a setting where a Norse Valkyrie might clash with the Aztec god Quetzalcoatl, or where heroes need to unite forces from different pantheons to combat a universal threat, following an approach that does not only enrich the gaming experience, but also foster a deeper appreciation of the diverse mythologies that have shaped human storytelling.
In essence, our manual is designed to offer maximum flexibility and creative freedom, allowing Game Masters and players to explore and benefit from different myths and tales originating from a wide array of cultures and folklores.

Book Structure

Spanning more than 350 pages, our compendium introduces a diverse and dynamic collection of over 300 statblocks from legends. This book is a treasure trove for enthusiasts and Game Masters alike, divided into six distinct sections, each detailing monsters and myths from various parts of the world. The sections are divided as follows:

  • American Mythology, which includes mythologies and traditions from Aztec, Maya, Inca, Native American and Southern American;
  • Asian Mythology, encompassing Japanese, Chinese, Hindu, and various other traditions across the entirety of the Asian continent;
  • Egyptian Mythology;
  • Greek Mythology;
  • Norse Mythology;
  • Other Mythologies, featuring creatures from a variety of other cultures from all around the world.

Each section delves into the captivating world of its respective tradition(s), featuring a dedicated segment that offers a broad overview of their histories and customs, including pantheons and other intriguing details.

Mythic Heroes

Each mythology is further enriched with a scalable mythic hero, an iconic figure pivotal to their respective mythos. For instance, in the Greek section, readers will encounter an Olympian hero, while the Asian section features a martial cultivator. These figures are presented with three distinct statblocks each - one at CR5, CR10, and CR15 - and equipped with a vast selection of additional custom traits that can also be applied to other creatures.

Through these traits, you can possibly adapt each statblock to reflect a specific hero from legends. For instance, an Olympian hero could be customized to represent Hercules, with enhanced strength and combat skills; Ulysses, known for his cunning and strategic mind; or Achilles, renowned for his unparalleled prowess in battle. The multitude of traits opens up a wide array of options, allowing Game Masters to create a diverse range of legendary heroes (or villains) in unique and imaginative ways.

Unique Encounters

In addition to the statblocks, each creature is brought to life with a detailed entry describing its lore, often accompanied by fascinating legends that surround it. While the mythological aspect forms an integral part of this compendium, it serves primarily as an inspirational backdrop to the diverse creatures within. Our manual has been thoughtfully designed to cater to a wide range of campaigns and play styles, offering a substantial selection of Challenge Ratings (CRs) suitable for both gritty and epic adventures. To add an element of surprise and variability in encounters, we've included numerous additional variant traits, ensuring that even repeated encounters with the same creature remain fresh and challenging.

Multiphased Bossfights

Significantly, many creatures in this manual feature a unique second phase: the Mythological Phase, briefly detailed in the following sections. Alongside this, we provide guidelines for creating a Mythological Phase for other creatures that might not have one.

Free Preview

If you wish, you can download a preview of our manual by clicking on the image below.

In the annals of human history, mythology has always been the foundation to our collective imagination and quest for understanding and explaining the world around us. It's in this spirit that we crafted this manual, dedicated to adapting the rich and varied mythological creatures from various cultures into the 5E format. Our decision to focus on mythology stems from its undeniable significance in shaping human thought, art, and culture across the centuries. Mythological tales, with their pantheon of gods, heroic mortals, and mythic beasts, have always been an important tool not only to provide entertainment, but also impart moral lessons, explain natural phenomena, and offer insight into the human condition.
While many 5E settings already incorporate elements inspired by mythology, we noticed that many aspects and creatures from these traditions often remain unexplored or underrepresented in the game's content. Recognizing this gap, we felt compelled to create a manual that not only fills this void but also expands the scope of what mythological elements can offer to any campaign world. By integrating these mythical beings into the game, we aim to offer players and Game Masters alike a chance to experience the awe, wonder, and moral complexity that these stories encapsulated for our ancestors, now retooled for epic adventures and unforgettable campaign narratives. Our commitment to this theme is not a one-off endeavor; we envision creating more manuals in the future that continue to explore the uncharted territories of mythology within the 5E framework and beyond, bringing a wealth of new content, inspirations, and challenges to tables around the world.

A Mythological Phase is an optional second phase of combat that can be triggered under specific circumstances. This phase is designed to showcase the true, often hidden, might of legendary creatures, plunging players into an even more challenging and memorable combat scenario. The creature may receive various benefits, increasing its resilience, speed, or strength, further elevating the challenge it poses to the adventurers.

The Mythological Phase is triggered when a creature with a Mythological Trait is reduced under a certain hit points threshold, revealing the true depth of the creature's mythical nature and presenting unique challenges and strategies for players to encounter. We envisioned two different types of Mythological Phases, depending on the creature's type and the level of challenge Game Masters wish to create for their players: the Mythological Awakening and the Mythological Empowerment.

Mythological Phases are designed to transform encounters with mythological creatures into potentially deadly battles that require strategic thinking and resourcefulness. These phases are inherently difficult and are intended to test the limits of player characters in combat. They are particularly well-suited for groups that thrive on challenging combat scenarios, adding complexity and unpredictability that can make battles more engaging and memorable. Additionally, these phases offer versatility in scaling creatures to match the power level of player characters. By applying this mechanic to lower-level creatures, Game Masters can scale their threat to match more powerful adventurers, ensuring that even familiar foes can provide a new challenge.

This timeline depends on the time required to print the first review copies, have them shipped to us for quality assessment, work on any errata (provided by our capable proofreaders and your feedback), and then finally ship the final version to you.

We are a dynamic duo of content creators united by our love for tabletop role-playing games. Our story is one of friendship, creativity, and a shared journey through the vast and imaginative landscapes of TTRPGs. Our paths crossed years ago, initially as fellow players, taking turns in the roles of Game Master and player. This experience laid the foundation for a deep, collaborative friendship, one where our strengths as storytellers and GMs complemented each other perfectly.

Today, as DMSlash and JonnyDM, we founded Mythos Chronicles, dedicated to creating and sharing content that enhances and celebrates the TTRPG experience. We believe in the transformative power of storytelling and the unique magic that collaborative creativity brings to the gaming table. Our goal is to craft content that not only sparks the imagination but also strengthens the bonds within the 5E community.

Throughout our journey, we have honed our craft and emerged as bestselling authors for 5E, publishing on diverse platforms such as DMsGuild, DrivethruRPG, and Patreon. This Kickstarter project marks our first venture into crowdfunding, but it stands on a solid foundation of experience and a proven track record in creating engaging and beloved content for this amazing game.

If you wish, you can check out our adventures and past projects on Instagram:

nodes.story:
Greetings, daring adventurers! Prepare for an extraordinary journey with "100 Monsters & Villains for D&D 5e." This time, we are on a quest to unleash a horde of menacing creatures and malevolent adversaries for you to incorporate into your campaigns, making metagaming in combat a thing of the past! 

Our goal is to provide a treasure trove of diverse creatures, each designed to add layers of excitement and depth to your 5th Edition adventures. Join us in bringing these entities to life and make your tabletop experiences more thrilling than ever. While designed for the 5th edition of the world's most famous role-playing game, the monsters can be easily integrated into other systems.

100 Monsters & Villains for D&D 5e is a project that aims to elevate tabletop role-playing battles to new heights. We strive to provide GMs and players alike with a supplement of 100 Monsters & Villains that aren't just stat blocks; we provide you with the lore and origin so that in your hands, they become immersive challenges designed to enrich your gaming experience, and spread fear and excitement to your table!

This PDF Includes:

  • 10 Aberrations 
  • 10 Beasts 
  • 10 Constructs
  • 10 Elementals
  • 10 Fey
  • 10 Fiends
  • 10 Humanoids
  • 10 Monstrosities
  • 10 Plants
  • 10 Undead

Backers in the Collector tiers will receive codes to get a physical version of "100 Monsters & Villains for D&D 5e!" via DrivethruRPG. These codes are at cost, which means that you pay later to DrivethruRPG only for the manufacturing and shipping costs (we don't get any extra money from this).
