Meet Kardoula! Kardoula was born in the streets, on the outskirts of a  great kingdom, where she quickly developed a love for adventure and  exploration. As she grew older, her curiosity led her to break into a  nearby house, where she discovered the world of tabletop gaming.

With her sharp mind and natural charisma,  Kardoula quickly became a  skilled dungeon master, guiding adventurers through perilous quests and  treacherous dungeons. Her players were always impressed by her clever  puzzles and cunning traps, and they often marveled at her ability to  weave intricate storylines that kept them on the edge of their seats.

Introducing Tinos, the feline dungeon master! Tinos was born on an  island in the Aegean Sea in 2022. After being adopted by a group of  aspiring adventurers who loved nothing more than playing tabletop games  together, they quickly realized that Tinos had a keen interest in their  activities,  often batting at their dice and meowing with excitement  when they rolled particularly high numbers.

When he's not leading his adventurers on quests, Tinos loves to curl  up in a cozy spot and nap, purring contentedly as his players plot their  next move. With his quick wit, sharp mind, and boundless creativity,  Tinos is the purrfect dungeon master for any group of adventurers  looking for a challenging and rewarding gaming experience.

(Also our humans are veteran Game Masters with decades in tabletop RPGs and into D&D 5e since the beginning, with many challenging products delivered over the years)

nodes.description: After being out of print for over 20 years, the Big Eyes, Small Mouth multi-genre anime RPG is back in a Retro Second Edition!
nodes.name: BESM Retro Second Edition RPG plus BESM 4E Expansions
nodes.risks:
Dyskami Publishing Company has extensive experience managing and fulfilling Kickstarters. Our company has done this before many times and we have done it exceptionally well.

This project is managed by creatives and entrepreneurs who have many years of experience with the hobby gaming industry. Additionally, the game design, writing, and graphic production for all products is complete. Consequently, with our extensive planning and management protocols in place, we believe that the risks and challenges are minimal for this project.

That said, the world is still experiencing the tail end of unprecedented supply chain issues that are impacting the hobby game industry. Unanticipated COVID-19 pandemic restrictions and ongoing freight issues may consequently result in some shipping delays (as they have in the past). We have built extra room into our announced release date to accommodate this, but we may have underestimated the lingering global situation.

As always, our goal is to ensure our Kickstarter backers are the first to receive their pledged game rewards. We will post campaign updates regularly from the end of the Kickstarter until we have fulfilled your pledges. After the campaign, we offer a refund on your physical pledge (minus the non-refundable Kickstarter and payment processing fees that we cannot recover). Digital-only rewards are non-refundable once the PDF download codes have been issued. If PDFs codes have already been sent to backers, but physical rewards have not, any requested refund of physical rewards will be reduced by the market price of the PDF rewards that were previously sent. Refunds are either processed via PayPal or through an alternate convenient method, at our discretion. Should you have questions about this Kickstarter's refund policy, please email info@dyskami.ca for clarification.
nodes.story:
After working towards a dream for more than a decade, we have finally achieved it! Dyskami Publishing is proud to announce that we have acquired all rights to the Tri-Stat System catalogue of games, including the hit anime and manga role-playing game, Big Eyes, Small Mouth (aka BESM). We have been publishing Fourth Edition titles under license from Paradox Interactive for the past few years, but our recent acquisition means we wanted to do something special for the longtime BESM fans.

In this Kickstarter, we are releasing a revised and updated "Retro" edition of BESM Second Edition – the perennial fan favourite from the turn of the millennium. We are also building upon the Anime Multiverse world and genre settings for BESM Fourth Edition with the first Prime World book of Ikaris: Epic Fantasy Anime Adventures. Finally, we round out the offerings with the Denizens of the Multiverse NPC and monster profile deck from across the cosmos and the second novel in the Ikarion isekai LitRPG trilogy, Ikarion Quest.

In short, this is going to be an amazing Kickstarter – with your help!

BESM Retro Second Edition

Welcome to Big Eyes, Small Mouth – the multi-genre role-playing game for all your anime and manga adventures! The two-time Origins Award-nominated Second Edition of this game debuted at Gen Con 2000, building upon on the anime RPG legacy that began three years earlier with BESM’s First Edition. Although the game line’s age is now approaching three decades – and BESM is currently enjoying new success in it’s Fourth Edition – Dyskami knows that the beloved Second Edition is still missed and fondly remembered as the "Green Book" (regular edition) or "Blue Book" (revised edition).

Big Eyes, Small Mouth Retro Second Edition (aka "Red Book") is for the fans. Get ready for expanded and updated content, including new character creation options, species and class templates, alternate rules, monster stats, example builds, and stunning artwork. Yet this is still the familiar Second Edition that you know and love – a throwback to a time of rolling low, Mecha Points, Combat Skills, and free-form anime action. Whether your gaming preference runs towards comedy or drama, fantasy or science fiction, horror or romance, shojo or shonen, Big Eyes, Small Mouth has everything you need to help you make your favourite characters and stories come to life.

Welcome back to BESM Second Edition – retro style.

This gorgeous 336-page book retains the familiar 6" x 9" digest-sized softcover format of the original Second Edition RPG. Alternatively, the exclusive Limited Collector's Edition – which won't be available for general purchase in retail stores – offers BESM the deluxe treatment and is presented with a durable hardcover, a convenient bookmark ribbon, and a premium-quality Smyth-sewn binding that allows your book to easily lay flat and stay open to any page.

BESM Ikaris: Epic Fantasy Anime Adventures

Ikaris is one of seven Prime Worlds of BESM’s official Anime Multiverse setting. This book explores the fantasy realm’s history and its many regions, peoples, alliances, monsters, heroes, and villains. Featuring plenty of ready-to-play game stats for equipment, weapons, vehicles, magical artefacts, and NPCs – as well as advice for running epic fantasy anime adventures – BESM Ikaris is an essential expansion for your RPG campaign.

This epic fantasy expansion presents 144 full-colour pages with beautiful illustrations from talented artists across the world. BESM Ikaris features a sturdy hardcover with a durable Smyth-sewn binding that allows your book to easily lay flat and stay open to any page.

BESM Denizens of the Multiverse Deck

This BESM Fourth Edition RPG accessory features a convenient deck of 136 characters and monsters from across the BESM's official Anime Multiverse setting. Characters are illustrated on the front of each 4” x 6” card with their BESM game stats listed on the back. These cards can be used at your gaming table in conjunction with only the core rules, or they can be paired with background details provided in the BESM Dramatis Personae and BESM Multiverse expansions.

Ikarion Quest: Isekai LitRPG Novel – Book Two

“An Omniversal executive is complaining that we never returned their virtuoid after the cross-over World Event. The next season of Rogue Angel starts in three weeks.” Monad CEO Louise Carrel’s lips quirked, the first show of emotion. “Don’t tell me something happened. You promised  that transferring AI between systems posed no risk.”

The pressure in his gut relaxed a fraction. She didn’t know. He still had time to set things right. Still had a chance to pretend the entire Ikarion Gate episode had never happened. Still had a chance to pretend the virtuoid hadn’t slipped off to another—quite real—realm of the Multiverse. All he had to do was find a way to do the impossible: reach a hand across the Multiverse, to the realm of Ikaris, and retrieve the Rogue Angel back to Ikarion and the Nexus. 

“Of course. I’ll look into it. Right away. Is there anything else?” he asked.

“That’ll be all. I don’t want to hear from that Omniverse exec again, you understand? Get it done.” The transmission terminated. 

With an explosive sigh, he sagged back. Ikarion was modeled after his grandfather’s diary entries on Ikaris, which until recently he’d considered to be a work of fiction. With the Ikarion Gate now gone, he was at a loss for how to retrieve the Rogue Angel. The clock was ticking and he had less than three weeks to do the impossible.

Ikarion Quest is an isekai LitRPG adventure novel – Book Two in the Ikarion trilogy, following Ikarion Gate – that unfolds in BESM's Anime Multiverse setting. What's a LitRPG, you ask? Here's the (edited) entry from the Wikipedia page:

"LitRPG, short for literary role playing game, is a literary genre combining the conventions of computer RPGs with science-fiction and fantasy novels. In LitRPG, games or game-like challenges form an essential part of the story, and visible RPG statistics (for example Body, Mind, and Soul) are a significant part of the reading experience. This distinguishes the genre from novels that tie in with a game, like those set in the world of Dungeons and Dragons; books that are actual games, such as the choose-your-own-path Fighting Fantasy type of publication; or games that are literally described, like MUDs and interactive fiction. Typically, the main character in a LitRPG novel is consciously interacting with the game or game-like world and attempting to progress within it."

Ikarion Quest continues the exploits of Tito, an anonymous Imago slummer who was mysteriously transported through the Ikarion VR MMO game into the real fantasy world of Ikaris as his alter ego identity, Card the Hedge Merchant. Trapped in a virtual realm with no way to log out, Card’s journey will soon force him to confront his newfound destiny.

This second Ikarion LitRPG novel is available in multiple formats:

  • 400-page printed hardcover novel, complete with dust jacket and foil-stamped cover
  • Digital text in a variety of formats (EPUB, MOBI, PDF)
  • 13-hour narrated audiobook

Download the free Ikarion Quest PDF preview of the first five novel chapters below or listen to a five-minute sample of the audiobook on Youtube.

Ikarion Quest is written by Ethan Freckleton, host of The Fearless Storyteller podcast and author of the Starship Ass trilogy, Banhammer Chronicles, Prophet of Virtue, and more. (https://www.ethanfreckleton.com) 

Audiobook narrated by Jonathan Sleep, best known for his voicework on the 9+ volume Caverns and Creatures LitRPG adventure series. (https://www.jonathansleepvoiceover.com)

You can customise your pledge to your exact specifications by selecting the reward level that most closely matches what you want to receive, and then selecting additional add-ons here in Kickstarter from the pop-up list of options presented with your pledge level. For example, to add a copy of the $40 BESM Retro Second Edition book to your $175 Completionist pledge, simply choose the Completionist pledge level and then click the add button for the BESM Retro print + PDF add-on. It's that easy!

The campaign add-ons include the options below. Many are available in only PDF form, or in a combined print+PDF/digital bundle. Note that the previously released titles (at the end of the list) should only be added on to pledges shipping to US or Canadian addresses due to international inventory levels.

  • BESM Retro Second Edition (Core RPG)
  • BESM Retro Second Limited Hardcover Collector Edition (Core RPG)
  • Upgrade: BESM Retro softcover to hardcover
  • BESM Ikaris: Epic Fantasy Anime Adventures
  • BESM Denizens of the Multiverse deck
  • Ikarion Quest: Book Two (LitRPG Novel)
  • Ikarion Gate: Book One (LitRPG Novel) - audiobook
  • BESM Fourth Edition (Core RPG)
  • BESM 4E Deluxe Limited Edition (Core RPG)
  • BESM Multiverse
  • BESM Multiverse Maps

Since we manage your pledge post-campaign in BackerKit, you'll also have the opportunity to make additional product selections at that time. Note that adding on extra items to your pledge may increase your shipping costs, as indicated in the section below.

You'll get exclusive early access to the complete digital PDFs in your pledge level (and add-ons) once you have completed the post-campaign survey in March 2024. We'll use industry leader DriveThruRPG.com to deliver all PDF content, so please ensure you have set up an account before you receive your PDF download codes. For physical copies, shipping charges are added on top of your Kickstarter pledge and form part of your pledge today.

We expect shipping of physical rewards in summer 2024. We indicate July 2024 in the reward tiers to build in some room for unanticipated printer/freight delays.

Kickstarter shipping costs are detailed in the table below based on your pledge level and shipping country. Including add-ons with your pledge may increase your shipping costs.

SHIPPING RESTRICTIONS

Due to numerous shipping problems experienced with international addresses when fulfilling previous campaigns, physical pledges made during this Kickstarter are only available to ship to the following countries:

United States, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, and EU countries (plus the United Kingdom, Norway, and Switzerland)

We encourage backers living in other countries to pledge for digital rewards.

There are many excellent reason to make a pledge during the BESM Retro Second Edition Kickstarter campaign, and we want to make the decision easy for you. Here are some great incentives to pledge your support:

  • Every pledge for physical rewards also comes with FREE download copies of their PDFs from DriveThruRPG, which are delivered promptly in March after the Kickstarter ends and you finalise your pledge – and that adds up to a huge savings!
  • Since PDFs of the new releases won't be made available on DriveThruRPG until later – and you'll receive your files in March – you'll get at least a month of exclusive early access to the PDFs for your pledge!
  • Your pledge funds contribute towards unlocking valuable stretch goals during the campaign that allows us to give you even more BESM awesomeness!
  • For physical books, we ship to our Kickstarter backers as soon as the freight arrives in our warehouse – well before the distribution chain receives its copies. This means you'll have your copies between several weeks and a few months before they are available in stores! 
  • Finally, funds from pledges like yours that push the campaign above the minimum threshold advance work on the BESM game line. This means we can reprioritise our work schedule, and allocate more resources towards creating and improving amazing future products at Dyskami. Your pledge here tells us that you want to see more multi-genre anime RPG releases from us.

This direct-to-consumers campaign is a vital component for expanding the BESM RPG line and distributing it worldwide. Dyskami Publishing strongly supports the efforts of independent game retailers as well, and has created a $2 retailer-only pledge level for verifiable brick-and-mortar stores. At this pledge tier, your store will receive a PDF of the BESM Fourth Edition Introductory Primer. Your pledge will let us know that you're interested in carrying these products in your retail story at a wholesale discount. Please contact us directly (info@dyskami.ca) for more information about how we can work together to help support the BESM RPG line at your store.

Dyskami Publishing Company is a tabletop game designer and publisher headquartered in Guelph, Ontario, Canada. In addition to the BESM RPG, Dyskami Publishing also creates the Anime 5E, Absolute Power, and Tri-Stat System RPGs and accessories. For more information about Dyskami Publishing, visit their website at dyskami.ca.

nodes.description: Riverside's shimmering debut "One" gets the vinyl treatment, with your help!
nodes.name: Reissue Riverside's 'One' on vinyl!
nodes.risks: We feel confident we can deliver this project as planned by late summer. If there are any unforeseen delays we promise to keep you up to date. We are working with proven partners for design, mastering and vinyl production.
nodes.story:
Philadelphia natives and former Sire recording artists Riverside are known for their dreamy, often melancholy rock, heavy on jangling guitars, shimmering and emotional tunes. Their debut One was a hit with critics and fans alike, with its ringing guitars and British-influenced tones, reminiscent of bands like Echo & the Bunnymen and The Smiths. They also had a strong affinity with another area band The Ocean Blue (whose keyboardist Steve Lau produced One). Their songs "Cinnamon Eyes" and "Waterfall" were staples on college radio and MTV.

With recent sold-out shows with The Ocean Blue, and growing fan excitement, it's the right time to bring this album back to the world in the format it deserves. Rising vinyl production costs and the intricacies of licensing from Warner Bros. make this a unique undertaking, so we're asking for your help to make this happen!

We anticipate costs to be around $17,000 to break even on this project. We at Lost in Ohio promise to deliver the highest possible quality sound and artwork (no fuzzy blown-up CD art here!). We are working on some details that we're pretty excited to share when the time comes, and we'll take you along for the ride with regular updates.

It wouldn't be Kickstarter without bundles, and there is something for everyone here. Vinyl is available in two limited edition variants: Waterfall Blue and Galaxie Yellow (mockups of each pictured above). We will also do a limited run of t-shirts and posters for you to snag (designs still in progress, but we'll share when they're done). The band has even found a hidden stash of CDs of their sophomore release Taste which you can add onto any order.

We are working toward a release date of late summer, and think this is very achievable. Our label has delivered several vinyl releases of the past few years, and we will be working with proven partners for vinyl mastering, lacquers and pressing.

International Customers:

As you may know, international shipping costs tend to fluctuate more rapidly than domestic shipping, and can even vary by country. For this reason, we will collect shipping for all international orders when we have product in hand. When we are ready to ship, you will receive a separate invoice for the exact shipping costs, which must be paid before we can deliver your order! We work with a proven shipping partner that will ensure we can get the lowest-possible price. (If you have questions, or want a rough estimate of shipping costs to your country, send us a message!)

The77 Publications have assisted 25 projects in achieving their Kickstarter goals and fulfilling them to backers in a timely manner.
If you have any issues or questions concerning the cost or date of the fulfilment of your reward, please message this campaign and/or email Ben Cullis at: The77publications@gmail.com
nodes.story:
THANK YOU ALL - BLAZER IS FULLY FUNDED        AND THE COMIC WILL BE SHIPPED IN APRIL!

Created by Steve MacManus as a love letter to the British weekly comics of his youth, BLAZER! has found a loyal audience amongst fans with similar, nostalgic memories of anthology titles where every issue ended with a flurry of cliff-hangers. 
Replicating the format of a regular British weekly of yesteryear, Blazer! number four will be 32-pages with four pages in colour. 

The Kickstarter ends on Sunday 11th February with and the comic will be shipped April. In the meantime, meet the BLAZER! Hot Shots and their searing strips!

THE COLLECTOR

Script: Steve MacManus Art: Charlie Gillespie
In this second episode: WHO is facing a funeral in Berlin? WHAT is the Cagney
Redemption? And WHEN will an apocalyptic prediction come true?

FLYBLOWN
 

Script: Alan Hebden Art: Jeremy Dunn
Three gap year travellers discover going walkabout in the outback is decidedly no picnic at hanging rock!

DEATHMATCH


Script & Art: Andrew Richmond.
Has wrestling professional Black Sabbath met his match in the form of the Thin Man? There’ll be the devil to pay if he loses!

TRANSYLVANIAN TALES

Script: Dave Heeley. Art: Mike Walters. Blazer editorial staffer Lupu presents another chilling tale from the land of bloodthirsty vampires!

DERRINGER & SO’N

Script & Art: Colin Maxwell.
It’s “Good Morning, Viet Nam” as we learn how Jack Derringer came to meet his future ward and pulp fiction-loving partner!

HERB and SPACEMAN
Ian Rogan and Ian Baker reveal the origin story of Blazer’s! comedic, duelling duo!

EXCLUSIVE KICKSTARTER REWARDS:

You are the editor!  (x1)       

BLAZER! Competition winners - did you win the Chopper bike, Space Hopper or Clackers? (x4)

Newsagents' mark - your name will appear on the cover (x1)

Signed BLAZER! scripts from Steve MacManus 

PLUS:

All four issues of BLAZER from £10!                                               

Exclusive T-shirts                                                                       

Signed copies of The SheerGlam Conspiracy 

ADD-ON REWARDS:

Can't see the combination of comics and other rewards you want?  We've got that covered! When you check-out, look out for the ADD-ON rewards.          

Ian Gibson's Lifeboat: his magnum opus available exclusively from The77 Publications

  • The77 Annuals 1 & 2: hardback backs - packed with over 100 pages of new strips
  • The77 comic 1-9: over 600 pages from emerging and established talent
  • This Comic is Haunted 1-3 will terrify and entertain you in equal amounts!
  • Pandora: The secrets of Pandora will be revealed inside! 
  • The SheerGlam Conspiracy (signed): The novel which tells the birth of BLAZER! 

Meet the BLAZER! team:

Steve MacManus began his editorial career in 1973 as a sub-editor on Valiant comic published by Fleetway Publications. He went on to work on Battle Picture Weekly and Action, before moving to Starlord and then 2000 AD, which he edited from 1979 to 1987, commissioning writers such as Alan Moore, Pat Mills, John Wagner and artists such as Simon Bisley, Steve Dillon and Alan Davies. Subsequently, he sought to establish a market aimed at older readers, launching the titles Crisis, Revolver and the Judge Dredd Megazine. He has written two volumes of autobiography: The Mighty One, My Life Inside The Nerve Centre and Elmsworld. His novel, The SheerGlam Conspiracy is the basis of several of the strips that appear in BLAZER!

Jeremy Dunn: Like so many others he loved Action and 2000ad. Primary art influences stem back to Bolland, McMahon, Gibson, Ewins, as well as Kirby, Ditko and Sienkiewicz. After studying graphic design, he has worked in the field since 1988, currently for the RNLI. His first published comic work Undertow, appeared in issue 2-5 of The77, written by his son Joe. The origin story then appeared in The77 Annual 2. 

Charlie Gillespie has been illustrating comics and books for over 30 years. He first appeared in The77 with Steve MacManus' Collector in issue 2 and then with Martin Fisher on a three-part story, Disposal (issues 5-8).  

Alan Hebden was born in Bristol in 1950, the son of comics writer and army major. He followed his father into the comics business, and started out with scripts for Commando, Victor and Hornet, then wrote for Battle Picture Weekly, scripting  "Rat Pack", creating 'Major Eazy' and 'El Mestizo' with Carlos Ezquerra, 'Fighting Mann' with Cam Kennedy, and 'The General Dies at Dawn' with John Cooper. For 2000AD he wrote many 'Future Shocks', and 'M.A.C.H. 1', but is best remembered for 'Meltdown Man', drawn by Massimo Berlardinelli. In 2022 he teamed up with Anna Morozova on 'STAR-NAV' in Pandora.

Dave Heeley is a co-funder of The77 Publications and resides near the Rad wastes of Birmingham and in between home-schooling and work, created Division'77, GRID and Silver Jubilee for The77 comic, Filth and the Furry for The77 Annual No1. and has launched The77 Publication's horror anthology, 'This Comic is Haunted', He actively campaigns for an extra hour in the day and spends his spare time sampling I.P.A beers and watching Spaghetti Westerns. 

Colin Maxwell is a writer and artist best known for his work for DC Thomson’s Commando. He has written and illustrated stories for many independent comics and publications, including for BLAZER! as well as his own small press, Maximized Comics. He specialises in comics featuring historical characters and events, but also writes science fiction and supernatural stories. He won the Dundee Comics Prize in 2017 and was awarded a Scots Language Publication Grant in 2023 by the Scottish Book Trust. He lives and works in Dunfermline, Scotland.

Andrew Richmond started doing a sketch a day a decade ago and continues to do so. He has collaborated with John A. Short on Sebastian Darc for David Lloyd’s Aces Weekly and Octobriana: Hammer. More recently he has appeared in The77 Annual, The77 Comic, Brawler, Reverend Cross, Future Quake, Zarjaz, Dogbreath, Monster Fun, Harker, Gideon Gunn, Gravestown and Mad Girl. He is also the art editor and designer on BLAZER!, Pandora and This Comic Is Haunted for The77 Publications and also contributes a comic strip to each title. He has also launched Richmond Press that has published many volumes of his own art and also an art book of renowned artist David A. Roach. www.andrewrichmondart.com

Mike Walters is a comic artist from Manchester and winner of the 2022 2000AD competition. His 2000AD credits include Future-shocks (written by Tom Watts and Honor Vincent), and Lowborn High (written by David Barnett). He is currently working with The77 Publications on multiple projects for The77, BLAZER! and This Comic is Haunted. His work can be found at https://www.instagram.com/mikewalters_art  

About The77 Publications

The77 Publications began creating comics in 2019 and since then have launched four successful titles: The77 comic (featuring sci-fi and fantasy), BLAZER!, Pandora (supernatural and emotional themes) and This Comic is Haunted (horror.)

We have also helped several well known creators launch their own books, including John Wagner and Robin Smith's 'The Bogie Man: The incomplete Case Files, Ian Gibson's Lifeboat and Laurence Alison's 'Warfighter'.

We have fulfilled over 20 Kickstarter campaigns and are renowned for shipping books and other rewards in a timely manner and offer a 'no-quibble, money back guarantee.

nodes.description: Brand new collection of the classic Manga Muerto comics!
nodes.name: MANGA MUERTO: THE PERFECT COLLECTION
nodes.risks:
Having run multiple crowdfunding campaigns on Kickstarter and IndieGoGo, and self-publishing my own work for 25 years, I'm very experienced in book production and fullfilment. As the new book is pretty much all completed it'll really be a matter of the print company and USPS not having any issues throughout their manufacturing abilities and supply chains.

I'm using vendors I've worked with for years for the buttons, stickers, prints and postcards. They're all American based so any issues with their supply chains would be the only obstacles in getting these products. 

And I've targeted April for the fullfilment of all orders to allow ample time to get all orders processed and mailed out. 

As usual, I always keep everyone updated via social media posts, but will use the Kickstarter email messaging center for any pertinent updates.
nodes.story:
MANGA MUERTO launches off in this brand new collection featuring his three classic stories, featuring Skeletron and a host of monstrous villains! A great all-ages entry point for the El Muerto character and his world. This 58 pg. trade paperback measures 7" x 10" and is packed with excitement and thrills!

Debuting in 2000 Manga Muerto was a whole new spin on El Muerto the Aztec Zombie. In this storyline Diego de La Muerte is a High School foreign exchange student from Mexico studying in Japan. Through what can only be considered complete coincidence, he's given control of a giant robot that only responds to the commands of a dead person! Mighty Skeletron and Manga Muerto join forces with Dr. Shimahara and his daughter Mariko in battle against an array of sinister robots and monsterous foes. 

Created for an all-ages readership and in homage to classic Japanese properties such as GIGANTOR and JOHNNY SAKKO AND HIS FLYING ROBOT, these adventures of MANGA MUERTO should bring a smile to your face.


The three original Manga Muerto stories included in the PERFECT COLLECTION are:
 

-"YOU ONLY DIE TWICE" (2000), the first appearance of Manga Muerto, written and penciled by Javier Hernandez with guest inker Rafael Navarro (SONAMBULO).
 


-"MANGA MUERTO & SKYMAN VS. THE MONSTER MEKS" (2001). Co-plotted, written and penciled by Javier Hernandez, co-plotted & inked by Ted Seko (BILLY COLE). Guest starring Ted Seko's SKYMAN FUSION ANDROID!


-"A DAY AT THE BEACH" (2009), written, penciled and inked by Javier Hernandez.

To incentivize everyone I'll be offering a free 3" king size Manga Muerto button to all Backers of a physical reward if we can get our initial $1000 funding goal met within the first 48 hours of the campaign! 


Also included is a Forword by Jorge Garza (TETLACTL) and a Muerto Museum Art Gallery featuring guest artists Damon Bagay, Brad Dwyer, Johnny Flores, Jose Itturiaga, Rafael Navarro and Ted Seko! Plus a historical essay on the creation of Manga Muerto and more surprises! 

Among the Reward Levels are opportunities to own some original artwork. Up for grabs are both the front and back cover art by creator Javier Hernandez as well as the original art for the pinup by Ted Seko, the original inker/co-plotter on MANGA MUERTO AND SKYMAN VS. THE MONSTER MEKS. A very rare chance to own some original comic book art from Ted Seko!


Another Reward level we think is unique is this one where you can get an original Japanese manga of Tetsujin-28 (the basis for the GIGANTOR animated cartoon from the 1960s). The Tetsujin manga, produced from 1956-1966 by creator Mitsuteru Yokoyama, was a big influence on the creation of Manga Muerto and Skeletron, so we thought we'd open up our personal library and make these classic manga available to you! These were published in the 1990s and measure 4.5" x 6.75", and come in the original Japanese language.



The book is completed so there won't really be any production time needed for that. We're asking you to purchase a copy through this campaign, and in the process get some extra Rewards depending on your Backer level. We've also included some Stretch Goals for all physical backers to benefit from, and Add-Ons in case you want to get some of the other books in the El Muerto Library.

nodes.description: Embark on an Epic Journey Through Ancient Egyptian Mysteries and Divine Conflict!

aiDisclosure.generatedByAiConsent: When it comes to AI art, we use platforms like Adobe FireFly, always ensuring that the source images are used with the explicit consent of the creator. This diverse mix allows us to create a visually rich and engaging world for you to explore.
aiDisclosure.generatedByAiDetails: We take pride in the visual experience we offer in our adventures. Our art is a blend of works from talented illustrators, carefully selected stock art, and cutting-edge AI-generated imagery.

nodes.name: Pyramids of Power, an Ancient Egyptian D&D 5e adventure
nodes.risks: D&D campaigns often require complex planning and extensive playtesting to ensure a balanced and engaging player experience. We will dedicate our efforts to fine-tuning every aspect of "Pyramids of Power" to ensure that every encounter, plot twist, and magic item is up to the standards you'd expect from a premium D&D 5e campaign.
nodes.story:
Dive into the sands of time with "Pyramids of Power," a thrilling D&D 5e compatible adventure. Set in a world where ancient Egyptian mythology and fantasy collide, this campaign promises a journey filled with mystery, danger, and ancient magic.

Pyramids of Power

In "Pyramids of Power," adventurers are drawn into a world where ancient magic and mythology intertwine, embarking on a journey filled with divine politics and ancient powers. Their mission is twofold: to recover the lost relics of Osiris, the god of the afterlife and resurrection, scattered across enigmatic pyramids, and to find the Eye of Horus, a legendary artifact rumored to grant foresight and protection.

The adventure unfolds in a series of acts, each presenting unique challenges and decisions. In the first act, the party learns about the fragmented relics of Osiris. Their quest leads them through multiple pyramids, each guarded by followers of Set, the god of chaos and disorder. The adventurers face intricate puzzles that test their wit and wisdom, reflecting Osiris's domain over life and death, as well as Set's chaotic influence. As they journey from pyramid to pyramid, they must contend with Set's minions, creatures embodying chaos and destruction.

The labyrinth of the Eye of Horus forms the crux of the second act. Hidden within a labyrinthine pyramid, the Eye is also sought by two rival factions: The Order of the Golden Falcon, an ancient society advocating for strict governance, and The Keepers of the Eternal Balance, a group of scholars and mages dedicated to maintaining the balance between order and chaos. High Commander Anupenkau and Priestess Ketet lead the Order, seeking the Eye to solidify their control, while Master Sebek and Lady Ta-pera from the Keepers aim to safeguard the Eye from misuse. The adventurers must navigate this labyrinth, facing mythical creatures from Egyptian lore, with each encounter bringing them closer to the Eye and forcing them to weigh the moral implications of their decisions.

The final act, The Convergence, sees the adventurers with the relics of Osiris and the Eye of Horus in hand, facing a momentous decision. They can use the relics to resurrect Osiris, potentially restoring balance but risking unknown consequences, or they can prevent his return, thus maintaining the status quo but possibly allowing Set's influence to grow. This act culminates in a grand confrontation, where the adventurers' choices shape the future of the land and affect the balance between mortals and deities.

Throughout their journey, the adventurers encounter many monsters steeped in Egyptian mythology. From undead guardians wrapped in ancient linens to jackal-headed humanoids serving Anubis, each monster presents a unique challenge. Sphinxes pose enigmatic riddles, while scorpionfolk and crocodile-headed warriors engage in combat. The depths of the pyramids are home to fire scorpions and necrotic vipers, and the adventurers must also contend with animated cursed statues and swarms of flesh-eating scarabs.

"Pyramids of Power: The Resurrection Gamble" is not just a quest for powerful artifacts but also a deep exploration of ancient mythology, moral dilemmas, and the consequences of meddling in the affairs of gods. The adventurers' journey through this mythical world is a test of their courage, wisdom, and morality.

Mysteries of Myth and Machine

"Mysteries of Myth and Machine" is a premium print hardcover collection that brings together three riveting Penny Blood Adventures, each offering a unique and immersive experience. This anthology opens with "Clockwork Tower," a steampunk adventure where players are challenged to fix a broken time machine, navigating through a world of gears and steam. Next, "Gorgon" invites adventurers into the mythical realm of the three Gorgon sisters, blending ancient lore with interactive storytelling. The collection concludes with "Pyramids of Power," an adventure that delves deep into the heart of ancient Egyptian mythology, unravelling mysteries shrouded in the sands of time. Together, these adventures offer a diverse journey through worlds where myth and technology intertwine, creating a tapestry of tales that are as compelling as they are varied.

Reward Levels

$5 - "Scribe's Scroll" (PDF)

  • Receive a digital PDF of the "Pyramids of Power" adventure.
  • Ideal for those who love to delve into new tales and lore.

$10 (Early Bird) / $12 (Standard) - "Explorer's Cache" (PDF+Digital Tools)

  • Early Bird for first 100 backers.
  • Includes PDF, eBook (ePub), maps, VTT files, tokens, printable cards for monsters and magic items.
  • Stage 0 content, expanded side quests, prewritten character sheets.
  • A treasure trove for digital adventurers and virtual tabletop enthusiasts.

$23 (Early Bird) / $25 (Standard) - "Traveler's Tome" (Softcover)

  • Early Bird for first 25 backers.
  • FREE shipping in the USA.
  • Full-color softcover 11 inch by 8.5 inch printed edition.
  • Includes all "Explorer's Cache" rewards.
  • A physical companion for those who walk the sands of imagination.

$45 (Early Bird) / $55 (Standard) - "Pharaoh's Edition" (Hardcover)

  • Early Bird for first 25 backers.
  • FREE shipping in the USA.
  • Full-color hardcover 11 inch by 8.5 inch printed edition.
  • Includes all "Explorer's Cache" rewards.
  • For collectors and guardians of ancient tales.

$60 (Early Bird) / $70 (Standard) - "Mysteries of Myth and Machine"

  • Early Bird for first 25 backers.
  • FREE shipping in the USA.
  • Includes PDF+Digital Tools from previous level.
  • Collects three PBA adventures: "Pyramids of Power," "Gorgon," and "Clockwork Tower" in one premium color hardback.
  • A grand anthology for seekers of diverse and legendary escapades.

$80 (Early Bird)/ $95 (Standard) - PBA Digital Library 

  • Collected together are 22 Penny Blood Adventures in digital format.
  • Each adventure includes all of the digital assets needed to create a fully immersive adventure.

$400 - Complete PBA Library of Adventures

  • Collected together are 22 Penny Blood Adventures.
  • Each adventure comes in full-color softcover prints.
  • Each adventure includes all of the digital assets needed to create a fully immersive adventure.

Stretch Goals

Stretch Goal #1 - $2,500: Enhanced Visual <-- Reached!

  • Option A: Dynamic Monster Artwork - Add detailed, dynamic illustrations for key monsters and villains to bring a fearsome edge to the adventure.
  • Option B: Maps - Create enhanced, digital maps for major locations, providing a more immersive exploration experience.

Stretch Goal #2 - $5,000: Deeper Story Elements <-- Reached!

  • Option A: Legendary Item Histories - Craft detailed histories and lore for significant magical items found in the adventure.
  • Option B: Secret Societies Lore - Expand the narrative with detailed descriptions and histories of secret societies within the adventure's world.

Stretch Goal #3 - $7,500: Enhanced Player Interaction <-- Reached!

  • Option A: Branching Dialogue Options - Develop branching dialogue scripts for key NPCs, allowing for more dynamic interactions.
  • Option B: Decision Impact Descriptions - Provide detailed descriptions of how different player decisions can impact the world and story.

Stretch Goal #4 - $10,000: Immersive Gameplay Additions <-- Reached!

  • Option A: More Traps - Develop unique traps to enhance the atmosphere of different locations.
  • Option B: Themed Puzzles - Design unique puzzles that are thematically tied to the adventure, enhancing problem-solving aspects.

Stretch Goal #5 - $12,500: Adventure Customization

  • Option A: Alternate Endings - Develop multiple ending scenarios based on player choices, adding replay value.
  • Option B: Adjustable Difficulty Encounters - Offer scalable encounter designs, allowing DMs to adjust the challenge level.

Stretch Goal #6 - $15,000: Expanded World Details

  • Option A: Cultural Compendium - Create a compendium detailing the cultures, traditions, and languages within the adventure’s world.
  • Option B: Architectural Guide - Develop a guide illustrating and describing the architectural styles of different regions and their significance.

Stretch Goal #7 - $17,500: Additional Content

  • Option A: Festival and Event Guide - Include a guide for festivals, ceremonies, and events that can occur during the adventure.
  • Option B: Expanded Bestiary - Add an expanded bestiary section with additional creatures, including lore, behavior, and encounter tips.

FAQ

What level is this game set for? The game is designed for a wide range of player levels. Each encounter includes instructions to scale the challenge for players from level 1 through 20. This flexible scaling ensures a unique and engaging experience each time you play.

When will you ship the digital downloads? We are committed to delivering all digital copies of the adventure within an hour or two after the campaign concludes.

When do physical books ship? Physical books will be shipped 8-10 weeks following the campaign's closure.

I am new to Penny Blood Adventures. How good is the content? If you're new to Penny Blood Adventures and curious about the quality of our content, we invite you to try our free one-shot campaign, The Fog Has Eyes. This sample adventure offers a glimpse into the exciting gameplay and storytelling you can expect from us.

Free Adventure: The Fog Has Eyes

We're thrilled to announce a free downloadable copy of “The Fog Has Eyes,” a 1-2 hour Penny Blood Adventure 1-shot. Dive into a town shrouded in mysterious fog, where players confront mutated creatures and moral choices. The journey leads to the EtherTech Research Facility, challenging adventurers to save the town or harness the fog's power.

This adventure is a perfect showcase of our signature structure at Penny Blood Adventures:

  • Encounter Name: Clearly titled to reflect the theme or challenge.
  • DM Information: Concise summaries for a clear understanding of each encounter's role.
  • Read Aloud: Atmospheric descriptions to set the scene for players.
  • Activities: Detailed guidance with variations, strategies, and outcomes.
  • Lair Actions: Unique actions or effects enhancing the encounter's challenge.
  • Scaling the Encounter: Tailored instructions for different player levels, ensuring an engaging experience for beginners, intermediates, and advanced players.
  • Monster/NPC Details: Comprehensive information for in-encounter interactions.

“The Fog Has Eyes” embodies our commitment to rich, replayable adventures with multiple conclusions. Its modular structure lets you seamlessly integrate elements into your own campaigns, enhancing your D&D experience. The game includes the PDF of the adventure, an ePub version for easy reading on an iPad, maps, tokens, and assets for online playing, and printable props you can share with your players.

Download your free copy here: https://bit.ly/479qeWx

nodes.description: A fun, interactive, and competitive tabletop game for hockey fans, gamers, fantasy hockey GMs, and people who like to win.

environmentalCommitments.description: High quality and durable materials will maximize the life of Hockey Hardware and its Kickstarter Rewards and Add-ons.

The Score Sheets are printed on both sides, so they can be reused for another game. Players may also prefer to keep the Score Sheets as an official record of Hockey Hardware games played. 

Overall, my product packaging plan uses far more paper products than plastic. Paper products are reusable and recyclable, and I encourage all Backers to reuse and recycle their product packages and paper filler as appropriate.

Pens are not included in Hockey Hardware for two reasons. First, it avoids the risk of a pen exploding inside the Game Box, which could cause a mess and ruin game components; and second, it helps the environment because most of us have extra pens lying around. This reduces unnecessary consumption and waste.

As part of my product supply and manufacturing plan, I intend to source as many products and components as possible from North American based suppliers and manufacturers. This reduces the distance products will have to travel, which saves on emissions.

Further, as part of my domestic shipping plan, I intend to use Canada Post flat rate boxes, which are very environmentally friendly. All flat rate boxes include carbon-neutral shipping.

As part of my Canadian packaging and shipping strategy, I intend to use Canada Post flat rate boxes. According to Canada Post, these boxes are produced with at least 60% recycled content and 25% post-consumer waste. They are 100% recyclable and printed using water-based inks.

As part of my US packaging and shipping strategy, I intend to use more paper products than plastic, such as Uline corrugated boxes and newsprint sheets for filler. Paper products break down more quickly than plastic, and is also reusable and recyclable.

nodes.question: What currency does your project use?
nodes.answer: Since we are based in Canada, we are using the Canadian Dollar.

nodes.question: What is the minimum and maximum pledge I can make?
nodes.answer:
The minimum pledge you can make is $1 CAD.
The maximum pledge you can make is $13,000 CAD.

nodes.question: Which countries do you ship physical items to?
nodes.answer: Physical items only ship to Canada and the USA at this time.

nodes.question: I live outside of Canada and the USA. Can I still participate in Hockey Hardware's Kickstarter Campaign?
nodes.answer:
Yes! You can still participate in Hockey Hardware's Kickstarter Campaign by pledging to digital rewards that are being offered or by simply making a pledge because you believe in our project.

If you want a digital reward, select the 'Fan Appreciation' Reward Tier, and feel welcome to select additional digital rewards being offered as Add-on items.

nodes.name: Hockey Hardware: The Original Game
nodes.risks:
This is my first-ever Kickstarter campaign. I discovered Kickstarter many years ago, long before Hockey Hardware. I knew back then that Kickstarter was a popular crowdfunding platform for creators to fund their creations. I also knew it was also a platform that I wanted to use if I ever became a creator and needed to crowdfund a project.

Soon after I began creating Hockey Hardware in late 2018, I took a deeper dive into learning more about Kickstarter. That's when I realized this campaign would be a very fun but serious undertaking. I also realized there was a lot of planning, research, and considerations that needed to go into building a Kickstarter campaign that would give Hockey Hardware its best chance of success. I was up for the challenge, and got to work.

Many aspects of this creative journey have taken me out of my comfort zone. Often, I have come into scenarios feeling vulnerable and insecure about my lack of knowledge or experience on certain subjects, like graphic design, packaging products, and shipping. But those feelings are good motivation to keep going and learn something new. Learning and discovery is a life-long process, and often, it's unpredictable, time consuming, costly, and can involve a lot of trial and error.

Throughout this Kickstarter journey, I have also met so many fantastic and friendly people, who have been exceptionally helpful and supportive. Hockey Hardware and this Kickstarter campaign has also given me a great reason to reconnect with old friends and distant family, who I've lost touch with over the years.

While many risks and challenges of this project are foreseeable and within my control, many are not. As a creator, I have to do my best to identify risks and challenges as early as possible, so these can be navigated and mitigated the best I can. It's also important to build-in flexibility and contingency into my planning, costs, and funding goal, so that there's a bit of a cushion for any unwanted surprises.

One early concern I had in this project was intellectual property protection. That's why I invested in getting Hockey Hardware registered as a trademark in both Canada and the US as soon as I felt confident that 'Hockey Hardware' was going to be my game's name. I also secured the copyright protection for the game.

Another early challenge was the costs of graphic design. Early on, I was paying for graphic design but I soon realized my graphic needs were far too great, and I simply could not afford to continue this approach. So, I decided to learn graphic design instead. It was like learning a new language, and YouTube was my teacher. 

Today, I have gained this transferable skill and I am knowledgeable in different graphic design programs. Learning how to do graphic design also saved me a lot of money that I invested into other areas of my project; it has given me far greater control over my projects; and I can carry these graphic design skills forward with me in future projects.

Much of the same can be said about designing and managing Hockey Hardware's website, www.HockeyHardware.com. Before undertaking this project, I had no idea how to design or build or run a website on the WIX platform. But now I do, and it's very liberating to learn these new skills. It also gives me greater control over my work, and helps reduce costs, so I can invest those funds into other areas.

Another risk that I've identified was the vulnerability and fragility of global supply chains in wake of the COVID-19 pandemic. After experiencing the unreliability and insecurity of some supply chains as a consumer during this time, I realized it was another reason to source from North American suppliers and manufacturers whenever possible.

These are just some of the risks and challenges I've experienced so far in my entrepreneurial journey, and I am certain there will be many more ahead. Hopefully, scaling up is one of them, if this campaign is tremendously successful.

Learning is a life-long process, and mistakes are always going to be made. With that said, every creator and their projects are subject to their own unique sets of risks and challenges. As creators, how and when we identify, respond, prevent, mitigate, and resolve these risks and challenges is key for increasing the chances of our project's success.
nodes.story:
It was the Fall of 2018. The evening was getting late, and I was getting ready for bed. As part of my nightly routine, I was on my phone, checking to see how my fantasy hockey team was doing that night. 

Suddenly, the idea hit me: the world has been missing a fantasy hockey inspired tabletop game. 

Any plans to sleep that night were immediately iced, as I got to work right away on scribbling down my concept.

Five years later, after countless hours of research, learning, designing, play testing, and development, Hockey Hardware®: The Original Game is in its final prototype stage, and ready for its Kickstarter debut!

Inspired by my passion for hockey, fantasy sports, and games, Hockey Hardware is a card and dice tabletop game that combines all three interests.

Play testers have described it as 'fun', 'interactive', and 'competitive', and it takes a mix of both good luck and strategy to win. 

Appropriate for ages eight and above, Hockey Hardware plays between two and four players, while typically taking anywhere between 45 minutes and two hours to play - depending on the number of players playing and their familiarity with the game.

Hockey Hardware was made for the hockey fan and game enthusiast, but anyone can quickly learn how to play, have fun, and win. No previous hockey knowledge or experience is needed.

Considering this, I believe there is a greater role for Hockey Hardware than simply being a tabletop game. I strongly support the notion that hockey is for everyone, and I believe that Hockey Hardware can help bridge gaps to accessing hockey. Beyond being a source of fun and entertainment, I believe Hockey Hardware has the ability to create new fans, which would grow the sport we love in Canada, the US, and beyond.

The objective of Hockey Hardware is to win the Champion’s Cup by having the most Trophy Cards at the end of the Third Period. Earn Trophy Cards by collecting as many Hockey Stats as you can by rolling the Stat Dice, strategically playing your Game Cards against opponents, and avoiding Adversity - if you can!

Players compete for 11 Trophy Cards in total. 

There are 15 Rounds in the Game Schedule, which are divided into three Periods and two Intermissions. Each Period has five Rounds before there's an Intermission.

At the start of the game, every player creates their Player Profile by determining their Conference, Position, and Roster Level. A player's Conference can start as either East or West, and their Position and Roster Level can start as either Forward Line 2 or Defence Pair 2.

A player's Conference, Position, and Roster Level can change multiple times throughout the game. These changes can impact which Trophy Cards they can compete for, and their ability to collect Hockey Stats. For example, the higher the Roster Level, the more Stat Dice a player can roll, and the more Hockey Stats they can collect; whereas the lower their Roster Level, the fewer Stat Dice they can roll, resulting in less Hockey Stats being collected.

Each player's turn consists of three stages: 1. Collect Hockey Stats; 2. Confront Adversity; and, 3. Play Game Cards.

Players collect Hockey Stats by rolling the Stat Dice at the start of the their turn based on their Roster Level. The stats up for grabs are Goals, Assists, Shots, Hits, Blocks and Plus Rating.

But avoid rolling Adversity! Adversity can set you back, disrupt your game strategy, or even derail your season entirely. Buy-Outs and Suspensions are the most punishing Adversity, while Line Demotions, Road Fatigue, and getting Benched can hurt your production.

After rolling your Stat Dice, tally your Hockey Stats on your Score Sheet, and then draw and resolve any Adversity Cards, if applicable. If you didn't roll any Adversity, you can skip this stage of your turn.

After the Adversity stage, it's time to draw and play your Game Cards. 

Game Cards reflect different hockey actions that can give you Leader Points, additional Hockey Stats, or intel about your opponents. For example, a Take Away card lets you steal a Hockey Stat from an opponent, while a Stick Lift card lets you secretly peek at a card in your opponent's hand, etc.

Roll the black Game Die to see how many Game Cards you can draw. Then, strategically play your Game Cards to get yourself ahead or push your opponents back. After you have finished playing your Game Cards, your turn is over.

At each Intermission, players will count their tallied Hockey Stats for each row on their Score Sheet. Then, players will handout the Hockey Hardware (Trophy Cards) to the leaders for each Trophy category. 

This process keeps a tab on the leaders, the threats, and the non-threats in the game, so you can adjust your strategy accordingly. Players can also use the Intermission to cash-in their Leader Points for a chance at the Captain's Trophy, and they will replenish their Game Cards if they have less than five in their hand to start the next Period.

The components included in Hockey Hardware®: The Original Game are:

  • 108 Cards, including 66 Game Cards, 30 Adversity Cards, and 12 Trophy Cards.
  • 16 Player Position Pieces, including 8 Forward Pieces and 8 Defence Pieces.
  • 7 Dice, including 5 Stat Dice, 1 Bonus Die (green), and 1 Game Die (black).
  • 4 Conference Pieces.
  • 1 Score Sheet Notepad, which includes 40 Score Sheet pages in total (20 sheets with two-sided print).
  • 1 Game Schedule, which includes 15 Rounds and 2 Intermissions.
  • 1 Rule Book.
  • Pens are not included.

Game Cards contain hockey actions that players can use to get themselves ahead or push their opponents back. The Game Deck includes Game Cards such as Break Away, Back Check, Give Away, Home Ice Advantage, Leader Points (1 and 2 LPs), Shift, Stick Lift, Take Away, Turnover, Waiver Claim, and Waiver Wire.

Adversity Cards contain different hockey-related challenges that can set-back, disrupt, or derail your game strategy. The Adversity Deck includes Adversity Cards such as Benched, Buy-Out, Conference Trade, Line Demotion, Position Switch, Road Fatigue, Shuffle, and Suspension. Avoid rolling too much Adversity - if you can!

The Trophy Cards are the Hockey Hardware! 

There are 12 Trophy Cards in Hockey Hardware®: The Original Game but players compete for 11 of them. The twelfth Trophy Card is the one trophy that rules them all - The Champion's Cup. The player with the most Trophy Cards after the Third Period ends is awarded The Champion's Cup, and wins the game.

Below is a list of the Hockey Hardware Trophy Cards that are in play: 

  • THE CHAMPION'S CUP: Awarded to the player who earns the most Hockey Hardware at the end of the Third Period. 
  • BEAST OF THE EAST: Awarded to the player with the most Assists (A), Goals (G), and Leader Points (LP) in the Eastern Conference.
  • BEST OF THE WEST: Awarded to the player with the most Assists (A), Goals (G), and Leader Points (LP) in the Western Conference.
  • BIG SHOT: Awarded to the player with the most Shots (S).
  • BLOCK OPS: Awarded to the player with the most Blocks (BL).
  • CAPTAIN: Awarded to the player with the most Leader Points (LP).
  • ELITE SNIPER: Awarded to the player with the most Goals (G).
  • THE ENFORCER: Awarded to the player with the most Hits (H).
  • MOST VALUABLE DEFENCE (MVD): Awarded to the Defence with the most Assists (A), Blocks (BL), Goals (G), Hits (H), Leader Points (LP), and Shots (S) combined. 
  • THE PLAYMAKER: Awarded to the player with the most Assists (A).
  • POWER FORWARD: Awarded to the Forward with the most Assists (A), Goals (G), Hits (H), Leader Points (LP), Plus Rating (+1), and Shots (S) combined. 
  • TOP RATED: Awarded to the player with the highest Plus Rating (+1). 

Player Position Pieces are key to creating your Player Profile. They contain information about your Position and Roster Level. Your Position (Forward or Defence) determines which Trophy Cards you can compete for, while your Roster Level (Forward Line 1, 2, 3, or 4 OR Defence Pair 1, 2, or 3) determines how many Stat Dice you can roll at the start of your turn.

There are seven dice in Hockey Hardware®: The Original Game.  The dice include 5 Stat Dice as well as 1 Bonus Die and 1 Game Die. 

Players collect Hockey Stats by rolling the Stat Dice. The Hockey Stats includeGoals, Assists, Blocks, Hits, Shots, and Plus Rating. They also determine if you face any Adversity on your turn.

You can roll the green Bonus Die on your turn if you are a Forward on Line 1, a Defence on Pair 1, or if you just played the Home Ice Advantage Game Card. All Bonus Stats are protected from opponents who might try to steal them from you.

All players roll the black Game Die on their turn to determine how many Game Cards they can draw from the Game Deck. The Game Die is also rolled when a player plays a Break Away or a Poke Check Game Card.

Each player gets a Score Sheet at the start of the game. Players use their Score Sheets to tally and count their Hockey Stats and Leader Points throughout the game. Score Sheets can also be used as a leaderboard to monitor your opponents as potential threats or targets.

The Game Schedule includes 15 Rounds divided into three Periods and two Intermissions. Each Period has five Rounds before there is an Intermission. The Game Schedule is a key tool that keeps the game on track. Interested Backers can choose to Sponsor a Round or an Intermission in the Game Schedule as an Add-on item in this Kickstarter campaign.

The Rule Book tells you all you need to know about how to play Hockey Hardware.

*A note on pens: While pens are a key component to playing this game, I opted not to include them as a way of reducing Hockey Hardware's environmental footprint and eliminating any risk of an accidental ink leakage from happening inside the box, which would ruin the game.

Promoting Hockey Hardware and raising awareness about this Kickstarter campaign are top priorities. While I have spearheaded this project to this point, it's going to take a big team effort to reach its funding goal, and bring it to life. Widespread promotion helps give this campaign its best chance of success.

Hockey Hardware promotional efforts began in the Fall of 2023. That's when I started publishing content on Hockey Hardware's social media platforms. These platforms include Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, X, and YouTube. Please Like, Follow, Subscribe, and Share Hockey Hardware content on these platforms if you aren't already!

Throughout this crowdfunding campaign, I have planned to host and attend various hockey and game-related events to help promote Hockey Hardware and raise awareness about its Kickstarter. While this serious undertaking is a lot of hard work and countless hours, it's important to have fun with it, too. Otherwise, what's the point?! I've always been a believer in the mantra of 'work hard, play hard'.

Some of Hockey Hardware's most notable planned Kickstarter events include: 

  • Hosting a Hockey Hardware Kickstarter Launch Party in Ottawa at Level One Game Pub on January 17; 
  • Attending the 2024 Frosty Mug Alumni Event at the Sleeman Centre in Guelph on January 18; 
  • Hosting a Hockey Hardware Kickstarter Party in Niagara at Ludology Boardgame Cafe in St. Catharines on January 22; 
  • Partnering with and attending The Carnegie Initiative Summit 2024 in Toronto;
  • Attending various events in Toronto during the 2024 NHL All-Star Weekend, including the NHL Fan Fair and NHL All-Star Thursday, which features the All-Star Player Draft, a ceremony to honour the 1967 Toronto Maple Leafs, and the Professional Women's Hockey League (PWHL) 3-on-3 Showcase.
  • Hosting multiple game nights in Ottawa; and more!

In addition, Hockey Hardware will also be promoted through paid-advertising on social media, while trying to create, discover, and leverage additional opportunities to score earned media across different mediums, too.

You can help Hockey Hardware reach its funding goal by making a pledge, by sharing this campaign with your family, friends, and social media, and by encouraging others to make a pledge to Hockey Hardware as well. It truly takes a village. Or in this case, a team, to turn this dream into a reality and make it come true. After all, teamwork makes the dream work.

The mission of this Kickstarter campaign is to bring Hockey Hardware to life. Your pledge will help Hockey Hardware get closer to achieving its mission objective, and hopefully, accomplishing it.

The funding goal of this campaign covers the costs of:

  • manufacturing Hockey Hardware;
  • procuring Rewards and Add-on items;
  • storage, fulfillment, and packaging items;
  • shipping items to Backers in Canada and the US; and,
  • taxes and fees.

MANUFACTURING THE GAME AND PROCURING REWARDS AND ADD-ONS
From the very beginning of creating Hockey Hardware, I have always placed an emphasis on doing my best to source components, materials, services, and items from North America. I believe in supporting North American jobs, businesses, and our economy as much as possible, whenever possible.

To make this campaign more fun, interesting, and entertaining, I am offering a wide variety of Reward Tiers and Add-ons that Backers can choose from, including physical items, experiences, and digital options. Through a lot of research, I have found North American suppliers and manufacturers for the following physical items, who I intend to source from after the campaign successfully funds:

  • The medallions, plaque, and glass award are sourced from a company in Winnipeg, Manitoba; 
  • The hockey pucks are sourced from a company in Bolton, Ontario; 
  • The hockey jerseys are made by a company in St. Catharines, Ontario;
  • Early game prototypes were made by a company in Madison, Wisconsin; and, 
  • Hockey Hardware games resulting from this Kickstarter campaign will be made by a domestic manufacturer in Montréal, Québec.

The only major component in Hockey Hardware that will be imported are the custom-designed dice. After significant research, time, costs, and comparing prototypes, I decided the best manufacturer of dice at this time is from a company overseas, which I was referred to by a Canadian business owner who sells dice in Kitchener, Ontario. To be clear, this Kitchener business only sells dice, they do not manufacture them.

STORAGE
My wife and I rent a small apartment unit, so we don't have enough space at home to store items and fulfill pledges. To complete these essential tasks, we'll need to rent some extra space at a nearby facility in Ottawa.

PACKAGING
A lot of time, thought, and experimentation has gone into the packaging strategy. I intend to use more paper than plastics in my packaging because paper products can be easily recycled and reused, and they breakdown more quickly. I have also carefully considered the size and weight of my Reward Tiers and Add-ons to improve their packaging efficiencies, both to reduce waste and save costs.

SHIPPING
For domestic shipping within Canada, most Reward Tiers and Add-ons will ship in a flat rate box from Canada Post. These flat rate boxes come with many benefits, including tracking; up to $100 of liability coverage for loss or damage; guaranteed on-time delivery in Canada; and they are environmentally friendly.

For shipping to the US, most Reward Tiers and Add-ons will be packed into corrugated boxes, and then shipped through Canada Post or a different shipping service. Items that don't need boxes will be shipped in envelopes and bubble mailers. Once shipped, most items will have a tracking number, and should arrive at their intended destination within 8 business days.

While most items should ship into the US duty-free, if any import, duty fees, or taxes are charged, it will be the responsibility of the receiver to pay for them upon the item being delivered to them.

FEES
After the funding goal is achieved, Kickstarter fees will cost 5% of the total funds raised and the payment processor will also take between 3-5%. I have budgeted for 4%.

TOTAL FUNDING GOAL BREAKDOWN (from highest to lowest expense):

  •    $65,000 - Manufacturing Hockey Hardware
  • + $31,000 - Packaging, Fulfillment & Shipping
  • + $11,500 - Kickstarter and Payment Processor Fees
  • + $10,000 - Procuring Rewards and Add-ons
  • + $5,000 - Storage
  • + $2,500 - Contingency
  • = $125,000 - Total Funding Goal

A lot of the research, ground work, and heavy lifting has already been done in the lead-up to this Kickstarter campaign. I am optimistic that all this early work will position me well to complete this campaign in a timely manner, and hopefully get everyone's pledges fulfilled and shipped before Christmas 2024.

Below is my estimated Kickstarter campaign timeline: 

  • January - February: Hockey Hardware Kickstarter Campaign.
  • March: Receive Funds from Kickstarter.
  • March - April: Order Hockey Hardware: The Original Game, Rewards, and Add-ons from suppliers and manufacturers.
  • April - July: Begin receiving items from suppliers and manufacturers. Organize and begin fulfillment.
  • July - October: Fulfillment.
  • November - December: Ship Rewards and Add-ons to Backers.

Thanks so much for taking the time to learn about Hockey Hardware and its Kickstarter campaign. This undertaking has been five years in the making, and a lot of time, money, and sacrifices have been made to give it the best chance of success.

When you love doing something, it doesn't feel like work. That's how passionate I've been about Hockey Hardware all these years. It's a project I truly believe in and want to bring to life. My goal is to make Hockey Hardware a reality for the benefit and enjoyment of hockey fans and gamers everywhere. With your pledge, successfully funding Hockey Hardware on Kickstarter would be a dream come true!

I'm 32 years old and happily married to my beautiful and supportive wife, Katherine. She is my Assistant Captain on this campaign. We live in Ottawa, Ontario with our two pups, Tuukka and Bella.

I'm an avid hockey fan. I consume as much hockey as I can. While my favourite NHL team to cheer for is the Ottawa Senators, I enjoy watching all the teams play, and I respect and appreciate all the teams and their players for the entertainment value they bring to the ice. In my view, ice hockey is one of the most exciting sports to play and watch. It's always fast-paced and loaded with action, from the opening puck drop to start the first period until the final horn to end the game.

I have always enjoyed playing sports and games. Two of my all-time favourite games are Settlers of Catan and Exploding Kittens.

For many years, I've possessed an entrepreneurial drive. Hockey Hardware is my first-ever creation and this campaign is my first-ever Kickstarter.

When I'm not working on Hockey Hardware or this Kickstarter campaign, I work full-time as a Communications Advisor and Legislative Assistant in Ottawa. I graduated from the University of Guelph in 2013 with a Bachelor of Arts degree, double majoring in Environmental Governance as well as Criminal Justice and Public Policy. After Guelph, I continued my post-secondary education and graduated with a Masters degree in Political Management from Carleton University in 2014.

I firmly believe hockey is for everyone, and so is Hockey Hardware.

As Hockey Hardware's potential grew stronger and brighter, I realized there was a need to establish a business entity for tax, administration, and organizational purposes to help design and develop Hockey Hardware, and eventually, aspire to market and sell it in the marketplace.

In February 2022, I registered a business with the Province of Ontario. I decided to call it FACE-OFF GAMES. I feel the name accurately reflects the competitive nature of the games that I enjoy playing, while at the same time, compliments its flagship brand, Hockey Hardware.

FACE-OFF GAMES values fun, fairness, and inclusivity. It is always important to be respectful and kind to others, and to treat everyone the way we want to be treated. Hockey is for everyone, and so is Hockey Hardware.

FACE-OFF GAMES aspires to become an independent game design studio that will create, develop, market, and sell various game brands, products, and merchandise for the enjoyment and entertainment of our fans everywhere.

environmentalCommitments.description: We manufacture these games ourselves by hand in Michigan. We use a minimal amount of energy and minimize waste in every operation.
Our products are constructed of domestically farmed wood and paper which should easily last several lifetimes.
All materials are recyclable.

nodes.name: BUT WAIT, There’s More Classic Strategy Board Games
nodes.risks:
Artwork, rules, and manufacturing method are ready for production — we're ready to start making games. We just need to know which ones you want! There's always the possibility of unseen risk, of course, but we've been manufacturing high-quality wooden toys and games here in Michigan for nearly 40 years. We ship other products daily and have the organization/experience in fulfillment for quick delivery via USPS Priority Mail. We’re confident about our budget and an August delivery date for everything.

We'll post regular updates here (and social media) throughout project funding, production and fulfillment. Thank you for your support. We're excited to get these games into your hands.
nodes.story:
Help us add 5 more classic strategy games to our Peg Pastimes series.

Over the past three years, we've published a collection of over 50 historic games, some dating back over 5,000 years. Thanks to our generous backers, we continue to produce one of the largest collections of traditional games on the planet.

There are more to come, and now you can be part of it!

Try one, three, or all 5 games ...

Our pledge levels are set so that you can try just one Peg Pastimes game or maximize your savings will all 5 new games. You can even add-on items to create bundles of other quantities. Back this project and get the best prices and first delivery of these exciting games.

Who are these games for?

Gamers of all ages who like fun and challenging board games will enjoy these classic strategy games from around the world. 

The Peg Pastimes collection has proven popular for classrooms and libraries. These games help to connect modern players to the cultures where these games originated and, in many cases, are still played today.

They’re also for serious game players who want to explore different game mechanisms from history and diverse cultures. The roots of all modern table-top games can be found in antiquity, and they can spark new appreciation for games that are popular today. 

The games in this new set:

Egara Guti is a classic head-to-head strategy game with a typical goal: eliminate all of your opponent's pegs or trap them so they can no longer move. In common with most of these Indian games, the competition begins with just one empty space on the board. All things are equal and balanced—an ancient contest of wits and skill.

The game we call Checkers in the U.S. has many names and many variations around the world. Like the melting pot of cultures in the Philippines, Filipino Dama is a blend of east and west that has been played for at least 600 years. Knowing how to play Checkers will help, but there are some clever and powerful rules to be wary of!

In 1878, the famed author Lewis Carroll devised the essence of this game. It's like nothing else, and yet there are familiar themes. It's a pattern-making game in which players attempt to get their pegs into a "rendezvous" area on the board. The rendezvous is different for every round, and can actually move during the game. Very interesting, sometimes surprising, and a bit of a brain-teaser.

Korea's long and rich history provides us with a host of traditional games from light-weight children's games to heavier strategic challenges. Pat Gonu is one of many "entrapment" games in which the objective is to make the last possible move. The game is at least 800 years old. A fast and fun little challenge, you may find it under the name "Hobak Gono" and other variants.

Many people are familiar with Nim games, and several variants have been produced commercially over the past century. The earliest evidence dates back to ancient China. This version was first documented in 1958, but is probably far older. An interesting twist on the basic objective: make your opponent take the last peg.

Thanks for backing this project.         We appreciate your continued support!
